00086 #if 0
00087 /** If a conversion from 'fromAtomicType' to 'toAtomicType' may cause lost
00088     precision, issue a warning.  Don't warn for conversions to bool and
00089     conversions between signed and unsigned integers of the same size.
00090  */
00091 static void
00092 lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning(const AtomicType *toAtomicType, 
00093                             const AtomicType *fromAtomicType, 
00094                             SourcePos pos, const char *errorMsgBase) {
00095     switch (toAtomicType->basicType) {
00096     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
00097     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
00098     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
00099     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
00100     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
00101     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
00102     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
00103     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
00104     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
00105     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
00106     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
00107         if ((int)toAtomicType->basicType < (int)fromAtomicType->basicType &&
00108             toAtomicType->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
00109             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 && 
00110               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8) &&
00111             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT16 && 
00112               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16) &&
00113             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 && 
00114               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32) &&
00115             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 && 
00116               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64))
00117             Warning(pos, "Conversion from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for %s"
00118                     " may lose information.",
00119                     fromAtomicType->GetString().c_str(), toAtomicType->GetString().c_str(),
00120                     errorMsgBase);
00121         break;
00122     default:
00123         FATAL("logic error in lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning()");
00124     }
00125 }
00126 #endif
00127 
00128 Expr *
00129 Expr::TypeConv(const Type *toType, const char *errorMsgBase, bool failureOk,
00130                bool issuePrecisionWarnings) {
00131     /* This function is way too long and complex.  Is type conversion stuff
00132        always this messy, or can this be cleaned up somehow? */
00133     assert(failureOk || errorMsgBase != NULL);
00134 
00135     const Type *fromType = GetType();
00136     if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
00137         return this;
00138 
00139     // The types are equal; there's nothing to do
00140     if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType))
00141         return this;
00142 
00143     if (fromType == AtomicType::Void) {
00144         if (!failureOk)
00145             Error(pos, "Can't convert from \"void\" to \"%s\" for %s.",
00146                   toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00147         return NULL;
00148     }
00149 
00150     if (toType == AtomicType::Void) {
00151         if (!failureOk)
00152             Error(pos, "Can't convert type \"%s\" to \"void\" for %s.",
00153                   fromType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00154         return NULL;
00155     }
00156 
00157     if (toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()) {
00158         if (!failureOk)
00159             Error(pos, "Can't convert from varying type \"%s\" to uniform "
00160                   "type \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(), 
00161                   toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00162         return NULL;
00163     }
00164 
00165     // Convert from type T -> const T; just return a TypeCast expr, which
00166     // can handle this
00167     if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType->GetAsConstType()))
00168         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00169     
00170     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(fromType)) {
00171         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(toType)) {
00172             // Convert from a reference to a type to a const reference to a type;
00173             // this is handled by TypeCastExpr
00174             if (Type::Equal(toType->GetReferenceTarget(),
00175                             fromType->GetReferenceTarget()->GetAsConstType()))
00176                 return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00177 
00178             const ArrayType *atFrom = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromType->GetReferenceTarget());
00179             const ArrayType *atTo = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toType->GetReferenceTarget());
00180             if (atFrom != NULL && atTo != NULL && 
00181                 Type::Equal(atFrom->GetElementType(), atTo->GetElementType()))
00182                 return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00183 
00184             else {
00185                 if (!failureOk)
00186                     Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible reference types \"%s\" "
00187                           "and \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
00188                           toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00189                 return NULL;
00190             }
00191         }
00192         else {
00193             // convert from a reference T -> T
00194             Expr *fromExpr = new DereferenceExpr(this, pos);
00195             if (fromExpr->GetType() == NULL)
00196                 return NULL;
00197             return fromExpr->TypeConv(toType, errorMsgBase, failureOk);
00198         }
00199     }
00200     else if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(toType)) {
00201         // T -> reference T
00202         Expr *fromExpr = new ReferenceExpr(this, pos);
00203         if (fromExpr->GetType() == NULL)
00204             return NULL;
00205         return fromExpr->TypeConv(toType, errorMsgBase, failureOk);
00206     }
00207     else if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType->GetAsNonConstType()))
00208         // convert: const T -> T (as long as T isn't a reference)
00209         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00210 
00211     fromType = fromType->GetReferenceTarget();
00212     toType = toType->GetReferenceTarget();
00213     // I don't think this is necessary
00214 //CO    if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType))
00215 //CO        return fromExpr;
00216 
00217     const ArrayType *toArrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toType);
00218     const ArrayType *fromArrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromType);
00219     if (toArrayType && fromArrayType) {
00220         if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(), fromArrayType->GetElementType())) {
00221             // the case of different element counts should have returned
00222             // out earlier, yes??
00223             assert(toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount());
00224             return new TypeCastExpr(new ReferenceType(toType, false), this, pos);
00225         }
00226         else if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(), 
00227                              fromArrayType->GetElementType()->GetAsConstType())) {
00228             // T[x] -> const T[x]
00229             return new TypeCastExpr(new ReferenceType(toType, false), this, pos);
00230         }
00231         else {
00232             if (!failureOk)
00233                 Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be converted to type \"%s\" for %s.",
00234                       fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(),
00235                       errorMsgBase);
00236             return NULL;
00237         }
00238     }
00239 
00240     const VectorType *toVectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(toType);
00241     const VectorType *fromVectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(fromType);
00242     if (toVectorType && fromVectorType) {
00243         // converting e.g. int<n> -> float<n>
00244         if (fromVectorType->GetElementCount() != toVectorType->GetElementCount()) {
00245             if (!failureOk)
00246                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between differently sized vector types "
00247                       "\"%s\" -> \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
00248                       toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00249             return NULL;
00250         }
00251         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00252     }
00253 
00254     const StructType *toStructType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(toType);
00255     const StructType *fromStructType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(fromType);
00256     if (toStructType && fromStructType) {
00257         if (!Type::Equal(toStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType(),
00258                          fromStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType())) {
00259             if (!failureOk)
00260                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between different struct types "
00261                       "\"%s\" -> \"%s\".", fromStructType->GetString().c_str(),
00262                       toStructType->GetString().c_str());
00263             return NULL;
00264         }
00265 
00266         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00267     }
00268 
00269     const EnumType *toEnumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
00270     const EnumType *fromEnumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(fromType);
00271     if (toEnumType != NULL && fromEnumType != NULL) {
00272         // No implicit conversions between different enum types
00273         if (!Type::Equal(toEnumType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType(),
00274                          fromEnumType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType())) {
00275             if (!failureOk)
00276                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between different enum types "
00277                       "\"%s\" -> \"%s\".", fromEnumType->GetString().c_str(),
00278                       toEnumType->GetString().c_str());
00279             return NULL;
00280         }
00281 
00282         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00283     }
00284 
00285     const AtomicType *toAtomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
00286     const AtomicType *fromAtomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(fromType);
00287 
00288     // enum -> atomic (integer, generally...) is always ok
00289     if (fromEnumType != NULL) {
00290         assert(toAtomicType != NULL || toVectorType != NULL);
00291         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00292     }
00293 
00294     // from here on out, the from type can only be atomic something or
00295     // other...
00296     if (fromAtomicType == NULL) {
00297         if (!failureOk)
00298             Error(pos, "Type conversion only possible from atomic types, not "
00299                   "from \"%s\" to \"%s\", for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(), 
00300                   toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00301         return NULL;
00302     }
00303 
00304     // scalar -> short-vector conversions
00305     if (toVectorType != NULL)
00306         return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00307 
00308     // ok, it better be a scalar->scalar conversion of some sort by now
00309     if (toAtomicType == NULL) {
00310         if (!failureOk)
00311             Error(pos, "Type conversion only possible to atomic types, not "
00312                   "from \"%s\" to \"%s\", for %s.",
00313                   fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(), 
00314                   errorMsgBase);
00315         return NULL;
00316     }
00317 
00318 #if 0
00319     // Disable: it's not clear this is actually all that useful
00320     if (!failureOk && issuePrecisionWarnings)
00321         lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning(toAtomicType, fromAtomicType, pos, 
00322                                     errorMsgBase);
00323 #endif
00324 
00325     return new TypeCastExpr(toType, this, pos);
00326 }

00329 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00330 
00331 /** Given an atomic or vector type, this returns a boolean type with the
00332     same "shape".  In other words, if the given type is a vector type of
00333     three uniform ints, the returned type is a vector type of three uniform
00334     bools. */
00335 static const Type *
00336 lMatchingBoolType(const Type *type) {
00337     bool uniformTest = type->IsUniformType();
00338     const AtomicType *boolBase = uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
00339                                                AtomicType::VaryingBool;
00340     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
00341     if (vt != NULL)
00342         return new VectorType(boolBase, vt->GetElementCount());
00343     else {
00344         assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL);
00345         return boolBase;
00346     }
00347 }

00350 // UnaryExpr
00351 
00352 static llvm::Constant *
00353 lLLVMConstantValue(const Type *type, llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, double value) {
00354     const AtomicType *atomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
00355     const EnumType *enumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type);
00356     const VectorType *vectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
00357 
00358     // This function is only called with, and only works for atomic, enum,
00359     // and vector types.
00360     assert(atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL || vectorType != NULL);
00361 
00362     if (atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL) {
00363         // If it's an atomic or enuemrator type, then figure out which of
00364         // the llvmutil.h functions to call to get the corresponding
00365         // constant and then call it...
00366         bool isUniform = type->IsUniformType();
00367         AtomicType::BasicType basicType = (enumType != NULL) ? 
00368             AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 : atomicType->basicType;
00369 
00370         switch (basicType) {
00371         case AtomicType::TYPE_VOID:
00372             FATAL("can't get constant value for void type");
00373             return NULL;
00374         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
00375             if (isUniform)
00376                 return (value != 0.) ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
00377             else
00378                 return LLVMBoolVector(value != 0.);
00379         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
00380             int i = (int)value;
00381             assert((double)i == value);
00382             return isUniform ? LLVMInt8(i) : LLVMInt8Vector(i);
00383         }
00384         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
00385             unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
00386             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt8(i) : LLVMUInt8Vector(i);
00387         }
00388         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
00389             int i = (int)value;
00390             assert((double)i == value);
00391             return isUniform ? LLVMInt16(i) : LLVMInt16Vector(i);
00392         }
00393         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
00394             unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
00395             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt16(i) : LLVMUInt16Vector(i);
00396         }
00397         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
00398             int i = (int)value;
00399             assert((double)i == value);
00400             return isUniform ? LLVMInt32(i) : LLVMInt32Vector(i);
00401         }
00402         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
00403             unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
00404             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt32(i) : LLVMUInt32Vector(i);
00405         }
00406         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
00407             return isUniform ? LLVMFloat((float)value) : 
00408                                LLVMFloatVector((float)value);
00409         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
00410             uint64_t i = (uint64_t)value;
00411             assert(value == (int64_t)i);
00412             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt64(i) : LLVMUInt64Vector(i);
00413         }
00414         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
00415             int64_t i = (int64_t)value;
00416             assert((double)i == value);
00417             return isUniform ? LLVMInt64(i) : LLVMInt64Vector(i);
00418         }
00419         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
00420             return isUniform ? LLVMDouble(value) : LLVMDoubleVector(value);
00421         default:
00422             FATAL("logic error in lLLVMConstantValue");
00423             return NULL;
00424         }
00425     }
00426 
00427     // For vector types, first get the LLVM constant for the basetype with
00428     // a recursive call to lLLVMConstantValue().
00429     const Type *baseType = vectorType->GetBaseType();
00430     llvm::Constant *constElement = lLLVMConstantValue(baseType, ctx, value);
00431     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmVectorType = vectorType->LLVMType(ctx);
00432 
00433     // Now create a constant version of the corresponding LLVM type that we
00434     // use to represent the VectorType.
00435     // FIXME: this is a little ugly in that the fact that ispc represents
00436     // uniform VectorTypes as LLVM VectorTypes and varying VectorTypes as
00437     // LLVM ArrayTypes leaks into the code here; it feels like this detail
00438     // should be better encapsulated?
00439     if (baseType->IsUniformType()) {
00440         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *lvt = 
00441             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(llvmVectorType);
00442         assert(lvt != NULL);
00443         std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
00444         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lvt->getNumElements(); ++i)
00445             vals.push_back(constElement);
00446     return llvm::ConstantVector::get(vals);
00447     }
00448     else {
00449         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *lat = 
00450             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(llvmVectorType);
00451         assert(lat != NULL);
00452         std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
00453         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lat->getNumElements(); ++i)
00454             vals.push_back(constElement);
00455         return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, vals);
00456     }
00457 }

00459 
00460 static llvm::Value *
00461 lMaskForSymbol(Symbol *baseSym, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00462     llvm::Value *mask = (baseSym->parentFunction == ctx->GetFunction() && 
00463                          baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC) ? 
00464         ctx->GetInternalMask() : ctx->GetFullMask();
00465     return mask;
00466 }
00467 
00468 
00469 /** Store the result of an assignment to the given location. 
00470  */
00471 static void
00472 lStoreAssignResult(llvm::Value *rv, llvm::Value *lv, const Type *type, 
00473                    FunctionEmitContext *ctx, Symbol *baseSym) {
00474     assert(baseSym != NULL &&
00475            baseSym->varyingCFDepth <= ctx->VaryingCFDepth());
00476     if (!g->opt.disableMaskedStoreToStore &&
00477         baseSym->varyingCFDepth == ctx->VaryingCFDepth() &&
00478         baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC &&
00479         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(baseSym->type) == NULL) {
00480         // If the variable is declared at the same varying control flow
00481         // depth as where it's being assigned, then we don't need to do any
00482         // masking but can just do the assignment as if all the lanes were
00483         // known to be on.  While this may lead to random/garbage values
00484         // written into the lanes that are off, by definition they will
00485         // never be accessed, since those lanes aren't executing, and won't
00486         // be executing at this scope or any other one before the variable
00487         // goes out of scope.
00488         ctx->StoreInst(rv, lv, LLVMMaskAllOn, type);
00489     }
00490     else {
00491         ctx->StoreInst(rv, lv, lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx), type);
00492     }
00493 }

00495 
00496 /** Utility routine to emit code to do a {pre,post}-{inc,dec}rement of the
00497     given expresion.
00498  */
00499 static llvm::Value *
00500 lEmitPrePostIncDec(UnaryExpr::Op op, Expr *expr, SourcePos pos,
00501                    FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00502     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00503 
00504     // Get both the lvalue and the rvalue of the given expression
00505     llvm::Value *lvalue = NULL, *rvalue = NULL;
00506     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL) {
00507         type = type->GetReferenceTarget();
00508         lvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00509 
00510         Expr *deref = new DereferenceExpr(expr, expr->pos);
00511         rvalue = deref->GetValue(ctx);
00512     }
00513     else {
00514         lvalue = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
00515         rvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00516     }
00517 
00518     if (lvalue == NULL) {
00519         // If we can't get a lvalue, then we have an error here 
00520         Error(expr->pos, "Can't %s-%s non-lvalues.",
00521               (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? "pre" : "post",
00522               (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? "increment" : "decrement");
00523         return NULL;
00524     }
00525 
00526     // Emit code to do the appropriate addition/subtraction to the
00527     // expression's old value
00528     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00529     llvm::Value *binop = NULL;
00530     int delta = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? 1 : -1;
00531     llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, delta);
00532     if (!type->IsFloatType())
00533         binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Add, rvalue, 
00534                                     dval, "val_inc_or_dec");
00535     else
00536         binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FAdd, rvalue, 
00537                                     dval, "val_inc_or_dec");
00538 
00539 #if 0
00540     if (type->IsUniformType()) {
00541         if (ctx->VaryingCFDepth() > 0)
00542             Warning(expr->pos, 
00543                     "Modifying \"uniform\" value under \"varying\" control flow.  Beware.");
00544     }
00545 #endif
00546 
00547     // And store the result out to the lvalue
00548     Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
00549     lStoreAssignResult(binop, lvalue, type, ctx, baseSym);
00550 
00551     // And then if it's a pre increment/decrement, return the final
00552     // computed result; otherwise return the previously-grabbed expression
00553     // value.
00554     return (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? binop : rvalue;
00555 }

00558 
00559 /** Utility routine to emit code to negate the given expression.
00560  */
00561 static llvm::Value *
00562 lEmitNegate(Expr *arg, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00563     const Type *type = arg->GetType();
00564     llvm::Value *argVal = arg->GetValue(ctx);
00565     if (type == NULL || argVal == NULL)
00566         return NULL;
00567 
00568     // Negate by subtracting from zero...
00569     llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, 0.);
00570     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00571     if (type->IsFloatType())
00572         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FSub, zero, argVal, "fnegate");
00573     else {
00574         assert(type->IsIntType());
00575         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, argVal, "inegate");
00576     }
00577 }
00578 
00579 
00580 UnaryExpr::UnaryExpr(Op o, Expr *e, SourcePos p) 
00581   : Expr(p), op(o) { 
00582     expr = e;
00583 }
00584 
00585 
00586 llvm::Value *
00587 UnaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00588     if (expr == NULL)
00589         return NULL;
00590 
00591     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00592 
00593     switch (op) {
00594     case PreInc:
00595     case PreDec:
00596     case PostInc:
00597     case PostDec:
00598         return lEmitPrePostIncDec(op, expr, pos, ctx);
00599     case Negate:
00600         return lEmitNegate(expr, pos, ctx);
00601     case LogicalNot: {
00602         llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00603         return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, "logicalnot");
00604     }
00605     case BitNot: {
00606         llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00607         return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, "bitnot");
00608     }
00609     default:
00610         FATAL("logic error");
00611         return NULL;
00612     }
00613 }
00614 
00615 
00616 const Type *
00617 UnaryExpr::GetType() const {
00618     if (expr == NULL)
00619         return NULL;
00620 
00621     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00622     if (type == NULL)
00623         return NULL;
00624 
00625     // For all unary expressions besides logical not, the returned type is
00626     // the same as the source type.  Logical not always returns a bool
00627     // type, with the same shape as the input type.
00628     switch (op) {
00629     case PreInc:
00630     case PreDec:
00631     case PostInc:
00632     case PostDec:
00633     case Negate:
00634     case BitNot: 
00635         return type;
00636     case LogicalNot:
00637         return lMatchingBoolType(type);
00638     default:
00639         FATAL("error");
00640         return NULL;
00641     }
00642 }
00643 
00644 
00645 Expr *
00646 UnaryExpr::Optimize() {
00647     if (!expr)
00648         return NULL;
00649 
00650     expr = expr->Optimize();
00651 
00652     ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
00653     // If the operand isn't a constant, then we can't do any optimization
00654     // here...
00655     if (constExpr == NULL)
00656         return this;
00657 
00658     const Type *type = constExpr->GetType();
00659     bool isEnumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL;
00660 
00661     const Type *baseType = type->GetAsNonConstType()->GetAsUniformType();
00662     if (baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt8 ||
00663         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt8 ||
00664         baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt16 ||
00665         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt16 ||
00666         baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt64 ||
00667         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt64)
00668         // FIXME: should handle these at some point; for now we only do
00669         // constant folding for bool, int32 and float types...
00670         return this;
00671 
00672     switch (op) {
00673     case PreInc:
00674     case PreDec:
00675     case PostInc:
00676     case PostDec:
00677         // this shouldn't happen--it's illegal to modify a contant value..
00678         // An error will be issued elsewhere...
00679         return this;
00680     case Negate: {
00681         // Since we currently only handle int32 and floats here, it's safe
00682         // to stuff whatever we have into a double, do the negate as a
00683         // double, and then return a ConstExpr with the same type as the
00684         // original...
00685         double v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00686         int count = constExpr->AsDouble(v);
00687         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00688             v[i] = -v[i];
00689         return new ConstExpr(constExpr, v);
00690     }
00691     case BitNot: {
00692         if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt32 || 
00693             type == AtomicType::VaryingInt32 ||
00694             type == AtomicType::UniformConstInt32 || 
00695             type == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32) {
00696             int32_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00697             int count = constExpr->AsInt32(v);
00698             for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00699                 v[i] = ~v[i];
00700             return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
00701         }
00702         else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt32 || 
00703                  type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
00704                  type == AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32 || 
00705                  type == AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32 ||
00706                  isEnumType == true) {
00707             uint32_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00708             int count = constExpr->AsUInt32(v);
00709             for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00710                 v[i] = ~v[i];
00711             return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
00712         }
00713         else
00714             FATAL("unexpected type in UnaryExpr::Optimize() / BitNot case");
00715     }
00716     case LogicalNot: {
00717         assert(type == AtomicType::UniformBool || 
00718                type == AtomicType::VaryingBool ||
00719                type == AtomicType::UniformConstBool || 
00720                type == AtomicType::VaryingConstBool);
00721         bool v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00722         int count = constExpr->AsBool(v);
00723         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00724             v[i] = !v[i];
00725         return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
00726     }
00727     default:
00728         FATAL("unexpected op in UnaryExpr::Optimize()");
00729         return NULL;
00730     }
00731 }
00732 
00733 
00734 Expr *
00735 UnaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
00736     if (expr != NULL) 
00737         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
00738     if (expr == NULL)
00739         // something went wrong in type checking...
00740         return NULL;
00741 
00742     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00743     if (type == NULL)
00744         return NULL;
00745 
00746     if (op == PreInc || op == PreDec || op == PostInc || op == PostDec) {
00747         if (!type->IsNumericType()) {
00748             Error(expr->pos, "Can only pre/post increment float and integer "
00749                   "types, not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
00750             return NULL;
00751         }
00752         return this;
00753     }
00754 
00755     // don't do this for pre/post increment/decrement
00756     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type)) {
00757         expr = new DereferenceExpr(expr, pos);
00758         type = expr->GetType();
00759     }
00760 
00761     if (op == Negate) {
00762         if (!type->IsNumericType()) {
00763             Error(expr->pos, "Negate not allowed for non-numeric type \"%s\".", 
00764                   type->GetString().c_str());
00765             return NULL;
00766         }
00767     }
00768     else if (op == LogicalNot) {
00769         const Type *boolType = lMatchingBoolType(type);
00770         expr = expr->TypeConv(boolType, "logical not");
00771         if (!expr)
00772             return NULL;
00773     }
00774     else if (op == BitNot) {
00775         if (!type->IsIntType()) {
00776             Error(expr->pos, "~ operator can only be used with integer types, "
00777                   "not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
00778             return NULL;
00779         }
00780     }
00781     return this;
00782 }
00783 
00784 
00785 int
00786 UnaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
00787     return (expr ? expr->EstimateCost() : 0) + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
00788 }
00789 
00790 
00791 void
00792 UnaryExpr::Print() const {
00793     if (!expr || !GetType())
00794         return;
00795 
00796     printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00797     if (op == PreInc) printf("++");
00798     if (op == PreDec) printf("--");
00799     if (op == Negate) printf("-");
00800     if (op == LogicalNot) printf("!");
00801     if (op == BitNot) printf("~");
00802     printf("(");
00803     expr->Print();
00804     printf(")");
00805     if (op == PostInc) printf("++");
00806     if (op == PostDec) printf("--");
00807     printf(")");
00808     pos.Print();
00809 }
00810 
00811 
00812 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00813 // BinaryExpr
00814 
00815 static const char *
00816 lOpString(BinaryExpr::Op op) {
00817     switch (op) {
00818     case BinaryExpr::Add:        return "+";
00819     case BinaryExpr::Sub:        return "-";
00820     case BinaryExpr::Mul:        return "*";
00821     case BinaryExpr::Div:        return "/";
00822     case BinaryExpr::Mod:        return "%";
00823     case BinaryExpr::Shl:        return "<<";
00824     case BinaryExpr::Shr:        return ">>";
00825     case BinaryExpr::Lt:         return "<";
00826     case BinaryExpr::Gt:         return ">";
00827     case BinaryExpr::Le:         return "<=";
00828     case BinaryExpr::Ge:         return ">=";
00829     case BinaryExpr::Equal:      return "==";
00830     case BinaryExpr::NotEqual:   return "!=";
00831     case BinaryExpr::BitAnd:     return "&";
00832     case BinaryExpr::BitXor:     return "^";
00833     case BinaryExpr::BitOr:      return "|";
00834     case BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd: return "&&";
00835     case BinaryExpr::LogicalOr:  return "||";
00836     case BinaryExpr::Comma:      return ",";
00837     default:
00838         FATAL("unimplemented case in lOpString()");
00839         return "";
00840     }
00841 }
00842 
00843 
00844 /** Utility routine to emit the binary bitwise operator corresponding to
00845     the given BinaryExpr::Op. 
00846 */
00847 static llvm::Value *
00848 lEmitBinaryBitOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *arg0Val,
00849                  llvm::Value *arg1Val, bool isUnsigned,
00850                  FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00851     llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
00852     switch (op) {
00853     case BinaryExpr::Shl:    inst = llvm::Instruction::Shl;  break;
00854     case BinaryExpr::Shr:
00855         if (isUnsigned)
00856             inst = llvm::Instruction::LShr; 
00857         else
00858             inst = llvm::Instruction::AShr; 
00859         break; 
00860     case BinaryExpr::BitAnd: inst = llvm::Instruction::And;  break;
00861     case BinaryExpr::BitXor: inst = llvm::Instruction::Xor;  break;
00862     case BinaryExpr::BitOr:  inst = llvm::Instruction::Or;   break;
00863     default:
00864         FATAL("logic error in lEmitBinaryBitOp()");
00865         return NULL;
00866     }
00867 
00868     return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, arg0Val, arg1Val, "bitop");
00869 }
00870 
00871 
00872 /** Utility routine to emit binary arithmetic operator based on the given
00873     BinaryExpr::Op.
00874 */
00875 static llvm::Value *
00876 lEmitBinaryArith(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *e0Val, llvm::Value *e1Val,
00877                  const Type *type, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
00878     llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
00879     bool isFloatOp = type->IsFloatType();
00880     bool isUnsignedOp = type->IsUnsignedType();
00881 
00882     switch (op) {
00883     case BinaryExpr::Add:
00884         inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FAdd : llvm::Instruction::Add;
00885         break;
00886     case BinaryExpr::Sub:
00887         inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FSub : llvm::Instruction::Sub;
00888         break;
00889     case BinaryExpr::Mul:
00890         inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FMul : llvm::Instruction::Mul;
00891         break;
00892     case BinaryExpr::Div:
00893         if (type->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
00894             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Division with varying integer types is "
00895                                "very inefficient."); 
00896         inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FDiv : 
00897                 (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::UDiv : llvm::Instruction::SDiv);
00898         break;
00899     case BinaryExpr::Mod:
00900         if (type->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
00901             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Modulus operator with varying types is "
00902                                "very inefficient."); 
00903         inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FRem : 
00904                 (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::URem : llvm::Instruction::SRem);
00905         break;
00906     default:
00907         FATAL("Invalid op type passed to lEmitBinaryArith()");
00908         return NULL;
00909     }
00910 
00911     return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, e0Val, e1Val, "binop");
00912 }
00913 
00914 
00915 /** Utility routine to emit a binary comparison operator based on the given
00916     BinaryExpr::Op.
00917  */
00918 static llvm::Value *
00919 lEmitBinaryCmp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *e0Val, llvm::Value *e1Val,
00920                const Type *type, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
00921     bool isFloatOp = type->IsFloatType();
00922     bool isUnsignedOp = type->IsUnsignedType();
00923 
00924     llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred;
00925     switch (op) {
00926     case BinaryExpr::Lt:
00927         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OLT : 
00928             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLT);
00929         break;
00930     case BinaryExpr::Gt:
00931         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OGT : 
00932             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGT);
00933         break;
00934     case BinaryExpr::Le:
00935         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OLE : 
00936             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLE);
00937         break;
00938     case BinaryExpr::Ge:
00939         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OGE : 
00940             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGE);
00941         break;
00942     case BinaryExpr::Equal:
00943         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OEQ : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ;
00944         break;
00945     case BinaryExpr::NotEqual:
00946         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE;
00947         break;
00948     default:
00949         FATAL("error in lEmitBinaryCmp()");
00950         return NULL;
00951     }
00952 
00953     llvm::Value *cmp = ctx->CmpInst(isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FCmp : 
00954                                     llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
00955                                     pred, e0Val, e1Val, "bincmp");
00956     // This is a little ugly: CmpInst returns i1 values, but we use vectors
00957     // of i32s for varying bool values; type convert the result here if
00958     // needed.
00959     if (type->IsVaryingType())
00960         cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
00961 
00962     return cmp;
00963 }
00964 
00965 
00966 BinaryExpr::BinaryExpr(Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p) 
00967     : Expr(p), op(o) {
00968     arg0 = a;
00969     arg1 = b;
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00973 llvm::Value *
00974 BinaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00975     if (!arg0 || !arg1)
00976         return NULL;
00977 
00978     llvm::Value *e0Val = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
00979     llvm::Value *e1Val = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
00980     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00981 
00982     switch (op) {
00983     case Add:
00984     case Sub:
00985     case Mul:
00986     case Div:
00987     case Mod:
00988         return lEmitBinaryArith(op, e0Val, e1Val, arg0->GetType(), ctx, pos);
00989     case Lt:
00990     case Gt:
00991     case Le:
00992     case Ge:
00993     case Equal:
00994     case NotEqual:
00995         return lEmitBinaryCmp(op, e0Val, e1Val, arg0->GetType(), ctx, pos);
00996     case Shl:
00997     case Shr:
00998     case BitAnd:
00999     case BitXor:
01000     case BitOr: {
01001         if (op == Shr && arg1->GetType()->IsVaryingType() && 
01002             dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1) == NULL)
01003             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Shift right is extremely inefficient for "
01004                                "varying shift amounts.");
01005         return lEmitBinaryBitOp(op, e0Val, e1Val, 
01006                                 arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
01007     }
01008     case LogicalAnd:
01009         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, e0Val, e1Val,
01010                                    "logical_and");
01011     case LogicalOr:
01012         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, e0Val, e1Val, 
01013                                    "logical_or");
01014     case Comma:
01015         return e1Val;
01016     default:
01017         FATAL("logic error");
01018         return NULL;
01019     }
01020 }
01021 
01022 
01023 const Type *
01024 BinaryExpr::GetType() const {
01025     if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01026         return NULL;
01027 
01028     const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
01029     if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
01030         return NULL;
01031 
01032     if (!type0->IsBoolType() && !type0->IsNumericType()) {
01033         Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of invalid "
01034               "type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), type0->GetString().c_str());
01035         return NULL;
01036     }
01037     if (!type1->IsBoolType() && !type1->IsNumericType()) {
01038         Error(arg1->pos,
01039               "Second operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of invalid "
01040               "type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), type1->GetString().c_str());
01041         return NULL;
01042     }
01043 
01044     const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, 
01045                                                      lOpString(op));
01046     // I don't think that MoreGeneralType should be able to fail after the
01047     // type checks above.
01048     assert(promotedType != NULL);
01049 
01050     switch (op) {
01051     case Add:
01052     case Sub:
01053     case Mul:
01054     case Div:
01055     case Mod:
01056         return promotedType;
01057     case Lt:
01058     case Gt:
01059     case Le:
01060     case Ge:
01061     case Equal:
01062     case NotEqual:
01063     case LogicalAnd:
01064     case LogicalOr:
01065         return lMatchingBoolType(promotedType);
01066     case Shl:
01067     case Shr:
01068         return type1->IsVaryingType() ? type0->GetAsVaryingType() : type0;
01069     case BitAnd:
01070     case BitXor:
01071     case BitOr:
01072         return promotedType;
01073     case Comma:
01074         return arg1->GetType();
01075     default:
01076         FATAL("logic error in BinaryExpr::GetType()");
01077         return NULL;
01078     }
01079 }
01080 
01081 
01082 #define FOLD_OP(O, E)                           \
01083     case O:                                     \
01084         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)         \
01085             result[i] = (v0[i] E v1[i]);        \
01086         break
01087 
01088 /** Constant fold the binary integer operations that aren't also applicable
01089     to floating-point types. 
01090 */
01091 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
01092 lConstFoldBinIntOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
01093     T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01094     int count = carg0->Count();
01095         
01096     switch (op) {
01097         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Mod, %);
01098         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Shl, <<);
01099         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Shr, >>);
01100         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
01101         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
01102         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
01103     default:
01104         return NULL;
01105     }
01106 
01107     return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
01108 }
01109 
01110 
01111 /** Constant fold the binary logical ops.
01112  */ 
01113 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
01114 lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
01115     bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01116     int count = carg0->Count();
01117 
01118     switch (op) {
01119         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
01120         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
01121         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
01122         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
01123         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
01124         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
01125         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
01126         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
01127     default:
01128         return NULL;
01129     }
01130 
01131     const Type *rType = carg0->GetType()->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
01132                                                         AtomicType::VaryingBool;
01133     return new ConstExpr(rType, result, carg0->pos);
01134 }
01135 
01136 
01137 /** Constant fold binary arithmetic ops.
01138  */
01139 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
01140 lConstFoldBinArithOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
01141     T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01142     int count = carg0->Count();
01143 
01144     switch (op) {
01145         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Add, +);
01146         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Sub, -);
01147         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Mul, *);
01148         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Div, /);
01149     default:
01150         return NULL;
01151     }
01152     
01153     return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
01154 }
01155 
01156 
01157 /** Constant fold the various boolean binary ops.
01158  */
01159 static ConstExpr *
01160 lConstFoldBoolBinOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const bool *v0, const bool *v1, 
01161                     ConstExpr *carg0) {
01162     bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01163     int count = carg0->Count();
01164 
01165     switch (op) {
01166         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
01167         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
01168         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
01169         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
01170         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
01171         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
01172         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
01173         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
01174         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
01175         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
01176         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
01177     default:
01178         return NULL;
01179     }
01180 
01181     return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
01182 }
01183 
01184 
01185 Expr *
01186 BinaryExpr::Optimize() {
01187     if (arg0 != NULL) 
01188         arg0 = arg0->Optimize();
01189     if (arg1 != NULL) 
01190         arg1 = arg1->Optimize();
01191 
01192     if (!arg0 || !arg1)
01193         return NULL;
01194 
01195     ConstExpr *constArg0 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg0);
01196     ConstExpr *constArg1 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1);
01197 
01198     if (g->opt.fastMath) {
01199         // optimizations related to division by floats..
01200 
01201         // transform x / const -> x * (1/const)
01202         if (op == Div && constArg1 != NULL) {
01203             const Type *type1 = constArg1->GetType();
01204             if (Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
01205                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat) ||
01206                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformConstFloat) ||
01207                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat)) {
01208                 float inv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01209                 int count = constArg1->AsFloat(inv);
01210                 for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
01211                     inv[i] = 1.f / inv[i];
01212                 Expr *einv = new ConstExpr(type1, inv, constArg1->pos);
01213                 Expr *e = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, einv, pos);
01214                 e = e->TypeCheck();
01215                 if (e == NULL)
01216                     return NULL;
01217                 return e->Optimize();
01218             }
01219         }
01220 
01221         // transform x / y -> x * rcp(y)
01222         if (op == Div) {
01223             const Type *type1 = arg1->GetType();
01224             if (Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
01225                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat) ||
01226                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformConstFloat) ||
01227                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat)) {
01228                 // Get the symbol for the appropriate builtin
01229                 std::vector<Symbol *> *rcpFuns = 
01230                     m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("rcp");
01231                 if (rcpFuns != NULL) {
01232                     assert(rcpFuns->size() == 2);
01233                     Expr *rcpSymExpr = new FunctionSymbolExpr("rcp", rcpFuns, pos);
01234                     ExprList *args = new ExprList(arg1, arg1->pos);
01235                     Expr *rcpCall = new FunctionCallExpr(rcpSymExpr, args, 
01236                                                          arg1->pos);
01237                     rcpCall = rcpCall->TypeCheck();
01238                     if (rcpCall == NULL)
01239                         return NULL;
01240                     rcpCall = rcpCall->Optimize();
01241                     if (rcpCall == NULL)
01242                         return NULL;
01243 
01244                     Expr *ret = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, rcpCall, pos);
01245                     ret = ret->TypeCheck();
01246                     if (ret == NULL)
01247                         return NULL;
01248                     return ret->Optimize();
01249                 }
01250                 else
01251                     Warning(pos, "rcp() not found from stdlib.  Can't apply "
01252                             "fast-math rcp optimization.");
01253             }
01254         }
01255     }
01256 
01257     // From here on out, we're just doing constant folding, so if both args
01258     // aren't constants then we're done...
01259     if (constArg0 == NULL || constArg1 == NULL)
01260         return this;
01261 
01262     assert(Type::Equal(arg0->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType(),
01263                        arg1->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType()));
01264     const Type *type = arg0->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
01265     if (type == AtomicType::UniformFloat || type == AtomicType::VaryingFloat) {
01266         float v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01267         constArg0->AsFloat(v0);
01268         constArg1->AsFloat(v1);
01269         ConstExpr *ret;
01270         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01271             return ret;
01272         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01273             return ret;
01274         else 
01275             return this;
01276     }
01277     if (type == AtomicType::UniformDouble || type == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) {
01278         double v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01279         constArg0->AsDouble(v0);
01280         constArg1->AsDouble(v1);
01281         ConstExpr *ret;
01282         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01283             return ret;
01284         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01285             return ret;
01286         else 
01287             return this;
01288     }
01289     if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt32) {
01290         int32_t v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01291         constArg0->AsInt32(v0);
01292         constArg1->AsInt32(v1);
01293         ConstExpr *ret;
01294         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01295             return ret;
01296         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinIntOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01297             return ret;
01298         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01299             return ret;
01300         else
01301             return this;
01302     }
01303     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
01304              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
01305         uint32_t v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01306         constArg0->AsUInt32(v0);
01307         constArg1->AsUInt32(v1);
01308         ConstExpr *ret;
01309         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01310             return ret;
01311         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinIntOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01312             return ret;
01313         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01314             return ret;
01315         else
01316             return this;
01317     }
01318     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformBool || type == AtomicType::VaryingBool) {
01319         bool v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01320         constArg0->AsBool(v0);
01321         constArg1->AsBool(v1);
01322         ConstExpr *ret;
01323         if ((ret = lConstFoldBoolBinOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01324             return ret;
01325         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01326             return ret;
01327         else 
01328             return this;
01329     }
01330     else
01331         return this;
01332 }
01333 
01334 
01335 Expr *
01336 BinaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
01337     if (arg0 != NULL) 
01338         arg0 = arg0->TypeCheck();
01339     if (arg1 != NULL) 
01340         arg1 = arg1->TypeCheck();
01341 
01342     if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01343         return NULL;
01344 
01345     const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
01346     if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
01347         return NULL;
01348 
01349     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type0) != NULL) {
01350         arg0 = new DereferenceExpr(arg0, arg0->pos);
01351         type0 = arg0->GetType();
01352         assert(type0 != NULL);
01353     }
01354     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type1) != NULL) {
01355         arg1 = new DereferenceExpr(arg1, arg1->pos);
01356         type1 = arg1->GetType();
01357         assert(type1 != NULL);
01358     }
01359 
01360     switch (op) {
01361     case Shl:
01362     case Shr:
01363     case BitAnd:
01364     case BitXor:
01365     case BitOr: {
01366         // Must have integer or bool-typed operands for these bit-related
01367         // ops; don't do any implicit conversions from floats here...
01368         if (!type0->IsIntType() && !type0->IsBoolType()) {
01369             Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
01370                   "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
01371             return NULL;
01372         }
01373         if (!type1->IsIntType() && !type1->IsBoolType()) {
01374             Error(arg1->pos, "Second operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
01375                   "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
01376             return NULL;
01377         }
01378 
01379         if (op == Shl || op == Shr) {
01380             bool isVarying = (type0->IsVaryingType() ||
01381                               type1->IsVaryingType());
01382             if (isVarying) {
01383                 arg0 = arg0->TypeConv(type0->GetAsVaryingType(), "shift operator");
01384                 type0 = arg0->GetType();
01385             }
01386             arg1 = arg1->TypeConv(type0, "shift operator", false, false);
01387             if (arg1 == NULL)
01388                 return NULL;
01389         }
01390         else {
01391             const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos,
01392                                                              "binary bit op");
01393             if (promotedType == NULL)
01394                 return NULL;
01395 
01396             arg0 = arg0->TypeConv(promotedType, "binary bit op");
01397             arg1 = arg1->TypeConv(promotedType, "binary bit op");
01398             if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01399                 return NULL;
01400         }
01401         return this;
01402     }
01403     case Add:
01404     case Sub:
01405     case Mul:
01406     case Div:
01407     case Mod:
01408     case Lt:
01409     case Gt:
01410     case Le:
01411     case Ge: {
01412         // Must be numeric type for these.  (And mod is special--can't be float)
01413         if (!type0->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type0->IsFloatType())) {
01414             Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
01415                   "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01416                   type0->GetString().c_str());
01417             return NULL;
01418         }
01419         if (!type1->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type1->IsFloatType())) {
01420             Error(arg1->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
01421                   "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01422                   type1->GetString().c_str());
01423             return NULL;
01424         }
01425 
01426         const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos,
01427                                                          lOpString(op));
01428         if (promotedType == NULL)
01429             return NULL;
01430 
01431         arg0 = arg0->TypeConv(promotedType, lOpString(op));
01432         arg1 = arg1->TypeConv(promotedType, lOpString(op));
01433         if (!arg0 || !arg1)
01434             return NULL;
01435         return this;
01436     }
01437     case Equal:
01438     case NotEqual: {
01439         if (!type0->IsBoolType() && !type0->IsNumericType()) {
01440             Error(arg0->pos,
01441                   "First operand to equality operator \"%s\" is of "
01442                   "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01443                   type0->GetString().c_str());
01444             return NULL;
01445         }
01446         if (!type1->IsBoolType() && !type1->IsNumericType()) {
01447             Error(arg1->pos,
01448                   "Second operand to equality operator \"%s\" is of "
01449                   "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01450                   type1->GetString().c_str());
01451             return NULL;
01452         }
01453 
01454         const Type *promotedType = 
01455             Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos, lOpString(op));
01456         if (promotedType == NULL)
01457             return NULL;
01458 
01459         arg0 = arg0->TypeConv(promotedType, lOpString(op));
01460         arg1 = arg1->TypeConv(promotedType, lOpString(op));
01461         if (!arg0 || !arg1)
01462             return NULL;
01463         return this;
01464     }
01465     case LogicalAnd:
01466     case LogicalOr: {
01467         // We need to type convert to a boolean type of the more general
01468         // shape of the two types
01469         bool isUniform = (type0->IsUniformType() && type1->IsUniformType());
01470         const AtomicType *boolType = isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
01471                                                  AtomicType::VaryingBool;
01472         const Type *destType = NULL;
01473         const VectorType *vtype0 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type0);
01474         const VectorType *vtype1 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type1);
01475         if (vtype0 && vtype1) {
01476             int sz0 = vtype0->GetElementCount(), sz1 = vtype1->GetElementCount();
01477             if (sz0 != sz1) {
01478                 Error(pos, "Can't do logical operation \"%s\" between vector types of "
01479                       "different sizes (%d vs. %d).", lOpString(op), sz0, sz1);
01480                 return NULL;
01481             }
01482             destType = new VectorType(boolType, sz0);
01483         }
01484         else if (vtype0)
01485             destType = new VectorType(boolType, vtype0->GetElementCount());
01486         else if (vtype1)
01487             destType = new VectorType(boolType, vtype1->GetElementCount());
01488         else
01489             destType = boolType;
01490             
01491         arg0 = arg0->TypeConv(destType, lOpString(op));
01492         arg1 = arg1->TypeConv(destType, lOpString(op));
01493         if (!arg0 || !arg1)
01494             return NULL;
01495         return this;
01496     }
01497     case Comma:
01498         return this;
01499     default:
01500         FATAL("logic error");
01501         return NULL;
01502     }
01503 }
01504 
01505 
01506 int
01507 BinaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
01508     return ((arg0 ? arg0->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01509             (arg1 ? arg1->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01510             ((op == Div || op == Mod) ? COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP : 
01511                                         COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP));
01512 }
01513 
01514 
01515 void
01516 BinaryExpr::Print() const {
01517     if (!arg0 || !arg1 || !GetType())
01518         return;
01519 
01520     printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01521     arg0->Print();
01522     printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
01523     arg1->Print();
01524     printf(")");
01525     pos.Print();
01526 }
01527 
01528 
01529 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01530 // AssignExpr
01531 
01532 /** Emit code to do an "assignment + operation" operator, e.g. "+=".
01533  */
01534 static llvm::Value *
01535 lEmitOpAssign(AssignExpr::Op op, Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1, const Type *type, 
01536               Symbol *baseSym, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
01537     llvm::Value *lv = arg0->GetLValue(ctx);
01538     if (!lv) {
01539         // FIXME: I think this test is unnecessary and that this case
01540         // should be caught during typechecking
01541         Error(pos, "Can't assign to left-hand side of expression.");
01542         return NULL;
01543     }
01544 
01545     // Get the value on the right-hand side of the assignment+operation
01546     // operator and load the current value on the left-hand side.
01547     llvm::Value *rvalue = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
01548     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01549     llvm::Value *mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
01550     llvm::Value *oldLHS = ctx->LoadInst(lv, mask, type, "opassign_load");
01551 
01552     // Map the operator to the corresponding BinaryExpr::Op operator
01553     BinaryExpr::Op basicop;
01554     switch (op) {
01555     case AssignExpr::MulAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mul;    break;
01556     case AssignExpr::DivAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Div;    break;
01557     case AssignExpr::ModAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mod;    break;
01558     case AssignExpr::AddAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Add;    break;
01559     case AssignExpr::SubAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Sub;    break;
01560     case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shl;    break;
01561     case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shr;    break;
01562     case AssignExpr::AndAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitAnd; break;
01563     case AssignExpr::XorAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitXor; break;
01564     case AssignExpr::OrAssign:  basicop = BinaryExpr::BitOr;  break;
01565     default:
01566         FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign()");
01567         return NULL;
01568     }
01569 
01570     // Emit the code to compute the new value
01571     llvm::Value *newValue = NULL;
01572     switch (op) {
01573     case AssignExpr::MulAssign:
01574     case AssignExpr::DivAssign:
01575     case AssignExpr::ModAssign:
01576     case AssignExpr::AddAssign:
01577     case AssignExpr::SubAssign:
01578         newValue = lEmitBinaryArith(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue, type, ctx, pos);
01579         break;
01580     case AssignExpr::ShlAssign:
01581     case AssignExpr::ShrAssign:
01582     case AssignExpr::AndAssign:
01583     case AssignExpr::XorAssign:
01584     case AssignExpr::OrAssign:
01585         newValue = lEmitBinaryBitOp(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue, 
01586                                     arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
01587         break;
01588     default:
01589         FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign");
01590         return NULL;
01591     }
01592 
01593     // And store the result back to the lvalue.
01594     lStoreAssignResult(newValue, lv, type, ctx, baseSym);
01595 
01596     return newValue;
01597 }
01598 
01599 
01600 AssignExpr::AssignExpr(AssignExpr::Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p) 
01601     : Expr(p), op(o) {
01602     lvalue = a;
01603     rvalue = b;
01604 }
01605 
01606 
01607 llvm::Value *
01608 AssignExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01609     const Type *type = NULL;
01610     if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL || (type = GetType()) == NULL)
01611         return NULL;
01612 
01613     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01614 
01615 #if 0
01616     if (ctx->VaryingCFDepth() > 0 && type->IsUniformType())
01617         Warning(pos, "Modifying \"uniform\" value under \"varying\" control flow.  Beware.");
01618 #endif
01619 
01620     Symbol *baseSym = lvalue->GetBaseSymbol();
01621     if (!baseSym) {
01622         // FIXME: I think that this check also is unnecessary and that this
01623         // case should be covered during type checking.
01624         Error(pos, "Left hand side of assignment statement can't be assigned to.");
01625         return NULL;
01626     }
01627 
01628     switch (op) {
01629     case Assign: {
01630         llvm::Value *lv = lvalue->GetLValue(ctx);
01631         if (!lv) {
01632             // FIXME: another, I believe, now unnecessary test?
01633             Error(lvalue->pos, "Can't assign to left-hand side of expression.");
01634             return NULL;
01635         }
01636 
01637         llvm::Value *rv = rvalue->GetValue(ctx);
01638         if (rv == NULL)
01639             return NULL;
01640 
01641         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01642 
01643         // Warn if we're assigning a large array
01644         const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
01645         if (at && at->TotalElementCount() > 4)
01646             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Copying %d element array in assignment expression.",
01647                                at->TotalElementCount());
01648 
01649 #if 0
01650         const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type);
01651         if (st != NULL) {
01652             bool anyUniform = false;
01653             for (int i = 0; i < st->NumElements(); ++i) {
01654                 if (st->GetElementType(i)->IsUniformType())
01655                     anyUniform = true;
01656             }
01657 
01658             if (anyUniform && ctx->VaryingCFDepth() > 0)
01659                 Warning(pos, "Modifying \"uniform\" value under \"varying\" "
01660                         "control flow.  Beware.");
01661         }
01662 #endif
01663 
01664         lStoreAssignResult(rv, lv, type, ctx, baseSym);
01665 
01666         return rv;
01667     }
01668     case MulAssign:
01669     case DivAssign:
01670     case ModAssign:
01671     case AddAssign:
01672     case SubAssign:
01673     case ShlAssign:
01674     case ShrAssign:
01675     case AndAssign:
01676     case XorAssign:
01677     case OrAssign: {
01678         // This should be caught during type checking
01679         assert(!dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) &&
01680                !dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type));
01681         return lEmitOpAssign(op, lvalue, rvalue, type, baseSym, pos, ctx);
01682     }
01683     default:
01684         FATAL("logic error in AssignExpr::GetValue()");
01685         return NULL;
01686     }
01687 }
01688 
01689 
01690 Expr *
01691 AssignExpr::Optimize() {
01692     if (lvalue) 
01693         lvalue = lvalue->Optimize();
01694     if (rvalue) 
01695         rvalue = rvalue->Optimize();
01696     if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL)
01697         return NULL;
01698 
01699     return this;
01700 }
01701 
01702 
01703 const Type *
01704 AssignExpr::GetType() const {
01705     return lvalue ? lvalue->GetType() : NULL;
01706 }
01707 
01708 
01709 Expr *
01710 AssignExpr::TypeCheck() {
01711     bool lvalueIsReference = lvalue &&
01712         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(lvalue->GetType()) != NULL;
01713     bool rvalueIsReference = rvalue &&
01714         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(rvalue->GetType()) != NULL;
01715 
01716     // hack to allow asigning array references e.g. in a struct...
01717     if (lvalueIsReference &&
01718         !(rvalueIsReference && 
01719           dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(rvalue->GetType()->GetReferenceTarget())))
01720         lvalue = new DereferenceExpr(lvalue, lvalue->pos);
01721 
01722     if (lvalue != NULL) 
01723         lvalue = lvalue->TypeCheck();
01724     if (rvalue != NULL) 
01725         rvalue = rvalue->TypeCheck();
01726     if (rvalue != NULL && lvalue != NULL) 
01727         rvalue = rvalue->TypeConv(lvalue->GetType(), "assignment");
01728     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) 
01729         return NULL;
01730 
01731     if (lvalue->GetType()->IsConstType()) {
01732         Error(pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand size of "
01733               "expression.", lvalue->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01734         return NULL;
01735     }
01736 
01737     return this;
01738 }
01739 
01740 
01741 int
01742 AssignExpr::EstimateCost() const {
01743     int cost = ((lvalue ? lvalue->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01744                 (rvalue ? rvalue->EstimateCost() : 0));
01745     cost += COST_ASSIGN;
01746     if (op == Assign)
01747         return cost;
01748     if (op == DivAssign || op == ModAssign)
01749         return cost + COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP;
01750     else
01751         return cost + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
01752 }
01753 
01754 
01755 void
01756 AssignExpr::Print() const {
01757     if (!lvalue || !rvalue || !GetType())
01758         return;
01759 
01760     printf("[%s] assign (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01761     lvalue->Print();
01762     printf(" ");
01763     if (op == Assign)    printf("=");
01764     if (op == MulAssign) printf("*=");
01765     if (op == DivAssign) printf("/=");
01766     if (op == ModAssign) printf("%%=");
01767     if (op == AddAssign) printf("+=");
01768     if (op == SubAssign) printf("-=");
01769     if (op == ShlAssign) printf("<<=");
01770     if (op == ShrAssign) printf(">>=");
01771     if (op == AndAssign) printf("&=");
01772     if (op == XorAssign) printf("^=");
01773     if (op == OrAssign)  printf("|=");
01774     printf(" ");
01775     rvalue->Print();
01776     printf(")");
01777     pos.Print();
01778 }
01779 
01780 
01781 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01782 // SelectExpr
01783 
01784 SelectExpr::SelectExpr(Expr *t, Expr *e1, Expr *e2, SourcePos p) 
01785     : Expr(p) {
01786     test = t;
01787     expr1 = e1;
01788     expr2 = e2;
01789 }
01790 
01791 
01792 /** Emit code to select between two varying values based on a varying test
01793     value.
01794  */
01795 static llvm::Value *
01796 lEmitVaryingSelect(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test, 
01797                    llvm::Value *expr1, llvm::Value *expr2, 
01798                    const Type *type) {
01799     llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(expr1->getType(), "selectexpr_tmp");
01800     // Don't need to worry about masking here
01801     ctx->StoreInst(expr2, resultPtr);
01802     // Use masking to conditionally store the expr1 values
01803     ctx->StoreInst(expr1, resultPtr, test, type);
01804     return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, LLVMMaskAllOn, type, "selectexpr_final");
01805 }
01806 
01807 
01808 llvm::Value *
01809 SelectExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01810     if (!expr1 || !expr2 || !test)
01811         return NULL;
01812 
01813     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01814 
01815     const Type *testType = test->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
01816     // This should be taken care of during typechecking
01817     assert(testType->GetBaseType() == AtomicType::UniformBool ||
01818            testType->GetBaseType() == AtomicType::VaryingBool);
01819 
01820     const Type *type = expr1->GetType();
01821     // Type checking should also make sure this is the case
01822     assert(Type::Equal(type->GetAsNonConstType(), 
01823                        expr2->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType()));
01824 
01825     if (testType == AtomicType::UniformBool) {
01826         // Simple case of a single uniform bool test expression; we just
01827         // want one of the two expressions.  In this case, we can be
01828         // careful to evaluate just the one of the expressions that we need
01829         // the value of so that if the other one has side-effects or
01830         // accesses invalid memory, it doesn't execute.
01831         llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
01832         llvm::BasicBlock *testTrue = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_true");
01833         llvm::BasicBlock *testFalse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_false");
01834         llvm::BasicBlock *testDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_done");
01835         ctx->BranchInst(testTrue, testFalse, testVal);
01836 
01837         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testTrue);
01838         llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
01839         // Note that truePred won't be necessarily equal to testTrue, in
01840         // case the expr1->GetValue() call changes the current basic block.
01841         llvm::BasicBlock *truePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
01842         ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
01843 
01844         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testFalse);
01845         llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
01846         // See comment above truePred for why we can't just assume we're in
01847         // the testFalse basic block here.
01848         llvm::BasicBlock *falsePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
01849         ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
01850 
01851         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testDone);
01852         llvm::PHINode *ret = ctx->PhiNode(expr1Val->getType(), 2, "select");
01853         ret->addIncoming(expr1Val, truePred);
01854         ret->addIncoming(expr2Val, falsePred);
01855         return ret;
01856     }
01857     else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) == NULL) {
01858         // if the test is a varying bool type, then evaluate both of the
01859         // value expressions with the mask set appropriately and then do an
01860         // element-wise select to get the result
01861         llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
01862         assert(testVal->getType() == LLVMTypes::MaskType);
01863         llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetInternalMask();
01864         ctx->SetInternalMaskAnd(oldMask, testVal);
01865         llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
01866         ctx->SetInternalMaskAndNot(oldMask, testVal);
01867         llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
01868         ctx->SetInternalMask(oldMask);
01869 
01870         return lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, testVal, expr1Val, expr2Val, type);
01871     }
01872     else {
01873         // FIXME? Short-circuiting doesn't work in the case of
01874         // vector-valued test expressions.  (We could also just prohibit
01875         // these and place the issue in the user's hands...)
01876         llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
01877         llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
01878         llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
01879 
01880         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01881         const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
01882         // Things that typechecking should have caught
01883         assert(vt != NULL);
01884         assert(dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) != NULL &&
01885                (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType)->GetElementCount() == 
01886                 vt->GetElementCount()));
01887 
01888         // Do an element-wise select  
01889         llvm::Value *result = llvm::UndefValue::get(type->LLVMType(g->ctx));
01890         for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01891             llvm::Value *ti = ctx->ExtractInst(testVal, i, "");
01892             llvm::Value *e1i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr1Val, i, "");
01893             llvm::Value *e2i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr2Val, i, "");
01894             llvm::Value *sel = NULL;
01895             if (testType->IsUniformType())
01896                 sel = ctx->SelectInst(ti, e1i, e2i);
01897             else
01898                 sel = lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, ti, e1i, e2i, vt->GetElementType());
01899             result = ctx->InsertInst(result, sel, i, "");
01900         }
01901         return result;
01902     }
01903 }
01904 
01905 
01906 const Type *
01907 SelectExpr::GetType() const {
01908     if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2)
01909         return NULL;
01910 
01911     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
01912     const Type *expr1Type = expr1->GetType();
01913     const Type *expr2Type = expr2->GetType();
01914 
01915     if (!testType || !expr1Type || !expr2Type)
01916         return NULL;
01917 
01918     bool becomesVarying = (testType->IsVaryingType() || expr1Type->IsVaryingType() ||
01919                            expr2Type->IsVaryingType());
01920     // if expr1 and expr2 have different vector sizes, typechecking should fail...
01921     int testVecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) != NULL ?
01922         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
01923     int expr1VecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(expr1Type) != NULL ?
01924         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(expr1Type)->GetElementCount() : 0;
01925 //CO    int expr2VecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(expr2Type) != NULL ?
01926 //CO        dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(expr2Type)->GetElementCount() : 0;
01927 //CO    assert(testVecSize == expr1VecSize && expr1VecSize == expr2VecSize);
01928     // REMOVE? old test
01929     assert(!(testVecSize != 0 && expr1VecSize != 0 && testVecSize != expr1VecSize));
01930     
01931     int vectorSize = std::max(testVecSize, expr1VecSize);
01932     return Type::MoreGeneralType(expr1Type, expr2Type, pos, "select expression", 
01933                                  becomesVarying, vectorSize);
01934 }
01935 
01936 
01937 Expr *
01938 SelectExpr::Optimize() {
01939     if (test) 
01940         test = test->Optimize();
01941     if (expr1) 
01942         expr1 = expr1->Optimize();
01943     if (expr2) 
01944         expr2 = expr2->Optimize();
01945     if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
01946         return NULL;
01947 
01948     return this;
01949 }
01950 
01951 
01952 Expr *
01953 SelectExpr::TypeCheck() {
01954     if (test) 
01955         test = test->TypeCheck();
01956     if (expr1) 
01957         expr1 = expr1->TypeCheck();
01958     if (expr2) 
01959         expr2 = expr2->TypeCheck();
01960 
01961     if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
01962         return NULL;
01963 
01964     const Type *type1 = expr1->GetType(), *type2 = expr2->GetType();
01965     if (!type1 || !type2)
01966         return NULL;
01967 
01968     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type1)) {
01969         Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be used in select expression", 
01970               type1->GetString().c_str());
01971         return NULL;
01972     }
01973     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type2)) {
01974         Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be used in select expression", 
01975               type2->GetString().c_str());
01976         return NULL;
01977     }
01978 
01979     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
01980     if (testType == NULL)
01981         return NULL;
01982     test = test->TypeConv(lMatchingBoolType(testType), "select");
01983     if (testType == NULL)
01984         return NULL;
01985     testType = test->GetType();
01986 
01987     int testVecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) ?
01988         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
01989     const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type1, type2, pos, "select expression", 
01990                                                      testType->IsVaryingType(), testVecSize);
01991     if (promotedType == NULL)
01992         return NULL;
01993 
01994     expr1 = expr1->TypeConv(promotedType, "select");
01995     expr2 = expr2->TypeConv(promotedType, "select");
01996     if (!expr1 || !expr2)
01997         return NULL;
01998 
01999     return this;
02000 }
02001 
02002 
02003 int
02004 SelectExpr::EstimateCost() const {
02005     return COST_SELECT;
02006 }
02007 
02008 
02009 void
02010 SelectExpr::Print() const {
02011     if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2 || !GetType())
02012         return;
02013 
02014     printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
02015     test->Print();
02016     printf(" ? ");
02017     expr1->Print();
02018     printf(" : ");
02019     expr2->Print();
02020     printf(")");
02021     pos.Print();
02022 }
02023 
02024 
02025 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02026 // FunctionCallExpr
02027 
02028 static std::string
