02029 lGetFunctionDeclaration(const std::string &name, const FunctionType *type) {
02030     std::string ret;
02031     ret += type->GetReturnType()->GetString();
02032     ret += " ";
02033     ret += name;
02034     ret += "(";
02035 
02036     const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes = type->GetArgumentTypes();
02037     const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &argDefaults = type->GetArgumentDefaults();
02038 
02039     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
02040         // If the parameter is a reference to an array, just print its type
02041         // as the array type, since we always pass arrays by reference.
02042         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(argTypes[i]) &&
02043             dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(argTypes[i]->GetReferenceTarget()))
02044             ret += argTypes[i]->GetReferenceTarget()->GetString();
02045         else
02046             ret += argTypes[i]->GetString();
02047         ret += " ";
02048         ret += type->GetArgumentName(i);
02049 
02050         // Print the default value if present
02051         if (argDefaults[i] != NULL) {
02052             char buf[32];
02053             if (argTypes[i]->IsFloatType()) {
02054                 double val;
02055                 int count = argDefaults[i]->AsDouble(&val);
02056                 assert(count == 1);
02057                 sprintf(buf, " = %g", val);
02058             }
02059             else if (argTypes[i]->IsBoolType()) {
02060                 bool val;
02061                 int count = argDefaults[i]->AsBool(&val);
02062                 assert(count == 1);
02063                 sprintf(buf, " = %s", val ? "true" : "false");
02064             }
02065             else if (argTypes[i]->IsUnsignedType()) {
02066                 uint64_t val;
02067                 int count = argDefaults[i]->AsUInt64(&val);
02068                 assert(count == 1);
02069 #ifdef ISPC_IS_LINUX
02070                 sprintf(buf, " = %lu", val);
02071 #else
02072                 sprintf(buf, " = %llu", val);
02073 #endif
02074             }
02075             else { 
02076                 int64_t val;
02077                 int count = argDefaults[i]->AsInt64(&val);
02078                 assert(count == 1);
02079 #ifdef ISPC_IS_LINUX
02080                 sprintf(buf, " = %ld", val);
02081 #else
02082                 sprintf(buf, " = %lld", val);
02083 #endif
02084             }
02085             ret += buf;
02086         }
02087         if (i != argTypes.size() - 1)
02088             ret += ", ";
02089     }
02090     ret += ")";
02091     return ret;
02092 }
02093 
02094 
02095 static void
02096 lPrintFunctionOverloads(const std::string &name,
02097                         const std::vector<std::pair<int, Symbol *> > &matches) {
02098     fprintf(stderr, "Matching functions:\n");
02099     int minCost = matches[0].first;
02100     for (unsigned int i = 1; i < matches.size(); ++i)
02101         minCost = std::min(minCost, matches[i].first);
02102 
02103     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i) {
02104         const FunctionType *t = 
02105             dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(matches[i].second->type);
02106         assert(t != NULL);
02107         if (matches[i].first == minCost)
02108             fprintf(stderr, "\t%s\n", lGetFunctionDeclaration(name, t).c_str());
02109     }
02110 }
02111 
02112 
02113 static void
02114 lPrintFunctionOverloads(const std::string &name,
02115                         const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs) {
02116     fprintf(stderr, "Candidate functions:\n");
02117     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
02118         const FunctionType *t = 
02119             dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(funcs[i]->type);
02120         assert(t != NULL);
02121         fprintf(stderr, "\t%s\n", lGetFunctionDeclaration(name, t).c_str());
02122     }
02123 }
02124 
02125 
02126 static void
02127 lPrintPassedTypes(const char *funName, const std::vector<Expr *> &argExprs) {
02128     fprintf(stderr, "Passed types: %*c(", (int)strlen(funName), ' ');
02129     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argExprs.size(); ++i) {
02130         const Type *t;
02131         if (argExprs[i] != NULL && (t = argExprs[i]->GetType()) != NULL)
02132             fprintf(stderr, "%s%s", t->GetString().c_str(),
02133                     (i < argExprs.size()-1) ? ", " : ")\n\n");
02134         else
02135             fprintf(stderr, "(unknown type)%s", 
02136                     (i < argExprs.size()-1) ? ", " : ")\n\n");
02137     }
02138 }
02139 
02140              
02141 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns zero
02142     cost if the call argument's type exactly matches the function argument
02143     type (modulo a conversion to a const type if needed), otherwise reports
02144     failure.
02145  */ 
02146 static int
02147 lExactMatch(Expr *callArg, const Type *funcArgType) {
02148     const Type *callType = callArg->GetType();
02149 
02150     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callType) == NULL)
02151         callType = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
02152     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(funcArgType) != NULL && 
02153         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callType) == NULL)
02154         callType = new ReferenceType(callType, funcArgType->IsConstType());
02155 
02156     return Type::Equal(callType, funcArgType) ? 0 : -1;
02157 }
02158 
02159 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
02160     of 1 if the call argument type and the function argument type match,
02161     modulo conversion to a reference type if needed.
02162  */
02163 static int
02164 lMatchIgnoringReferences(Expr *callArg, const Type *funcArgType) {
02165     int prev = lExactMatch(callArg, funcArgType);
02166     if (prev != -1)
02167         return prev;
02168 
02169     const Type *callType = callArg->GetType()->GetReferenceTarget();
02170     if (funcArgType->IsConstType())
02171         callType = callType->GetAsConstType();
02172 
02173     return Type::Equal(callType,
02174                        funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()) ? 1 : -1;
02175 }
02176 
02177 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
02178     of 1 if converting the argument to the call type only requires a type
02179     conversion that won't lose information.  Otherwise reports failure.
02180 */
02181 static int
02182 lMatchWithTypeWidening(Expr *callArg, const Type *funcArgType) {
02183     int prev = lMatchIgnoringReferences(callArg, funcArgType);
02184     if (prev != -1)
02185         return prev;
02186 
02187     const Type *callType = callArg->GetType();
02188     const AtomicType *callAt = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(callType);
02189     const AtomicType *funcAt = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(funcArgType);
02190     if (callAt == NULL || funcAt == NULL)
02191         return -1;
02192 
02193     if (callAt->IsUniformType() != funcAt->IsUniformType())
02194         return -1;
02195 
02196     switch (callAt->basicType) {
02197     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
02198         return 1;
02199     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
02200     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
02201         return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL) ? 1 : -1;
02202     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
02203     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
02204         return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
02205                 funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
02206                 funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8) ? 1 : -1;
02207     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
02208     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
02209         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
02210                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 ||
02211                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
02212                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64) ? 1 : -1;
02213     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
02214         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE) ? 1 : -1;
02215     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
02216     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
02217         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
02218                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64) ? 1 : -1;
02219     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
02220         return -1;
02221     default:
02222         FATAL("Unhandled atomic type");
02223         return -1;
02224     }
02225 }
02226 
02227 
02228 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
02229     of 1 if the call argument type and the function argument type match if
02230     we only do a uniform -> varying type conversion but otherwise have
02231     exactly the same type.
02232  */
02233 static int
02234 lMatchIgnoringUniform(Expr *callArg, const Type *funcArgType) {
02235     int prev = lMatchWithTypeWidening(callArg, funcArgType);
02236     if (prev != -1)
02237         return prev;
02238 
02239     const Type *callType = callArg->GetType();
02240     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callType) == NULL)
02241         callType = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
02242 
02243     return (callType->IsUniformType() && 
02244             funcArgType->IsVaryingType() &&
02245             Type::Equal(callType->GetAsVaryingType(), funcArgType)) ? 1 : -1;
02246 }
02247 
02248 
02249 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
02250     of 1 if we can type convert from the call argument type to the function
02251     argument type, but without doing a uniform -> varying conversion.
02252  */
02253 static int
02254 lMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(Expr *callArg, const Type *funcArgType) {
02255     int prev = lMatchIgnoringUniform(callArg, funcArgType);
02256     if (prev != -1)
02257         return prev;
02258 
02259     Expr *te = callArg->TypeConv(funcArgType, 
02260                                  "function call argument", true);
02261     if (te != NULL && 
02262         te->GetType()->IsUniformType() == callArg->GetType()->IsUniformType())
02263         return 1;
02264     else
02265         return -1;
02266 }
02267 
02268 
02269 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
02270     of 1 if there is any type conversion that gets us from the caller
02271     argument type to the function argument type.
02272  */
02273 static int
02274 lMatchWithTypeConv(Expr *callArg, const Type *funcArgType) {
02275     int prev = lMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(callArg, funcArgType);
02276     if (prev != -1)
02277         return prev;
02278         
02279     Expr *te = callArg->TypeConv(funcArgType, 
02280                                  "function call argument", true);
02281     return (te != NULL) ? 0 : -1;
02282 }
02283 
02284 
02285 /** Given a set of potential matching functions and their associated cost,
02286     return the one with the lowest cost, if unique.  Otherwise, if multiple
02287     functions match with the same cost, return NULL.
02288  */
02289 static Symbol *
02290 lGetBestMatch(std::vector<std::pair<int, Symbol *> > &matches) {
02291     assert(matches.size() > 0);
02292     int minCost = matches[0].first;
02293 
02294     for (unsigned int i = 1; i < matches.size(); ++i)
02295         minCost = std::min(minCost, matches[i].first);
02296 
02297     Symbol *match = NULL;
02298     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i) {
02299         if (matches[i].first == minCost) {
02300             if (match != NULL)
02301                 // multiple things had the same cost
02302                 return NULL;
02303             else
02304                 match = matches[i].second;
02305         }
02306     }
02307     return match;
02308 }
02309 
02310 
02311 /** See if we can find a single function from the set of overload options
02312     based on the predicate function passed in.  Returns true if no more
02313     tries should be made to find a match, either due to success from
02314     finding a single overloaded function that matches or failure due to
02315     finding multiple ambiguous matches.
02316  */
02317 bool
02318 FunctionCallExpr::tryResolve(int (*matchFunc)(Expr *, const Type *)) {
02319     FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
02320 
02321     const char *funName = fse->candidateFunctions->front()->name.c_str();
02322     std::vector<Expr *> &callArgs = args->exprs;
02323 
02324     std::vector<std::pair<int, Symbol *> > matches;
02325     std::vector<Symbol *>::iterator iter;
02326     for (iter = fse->candidateFunctions->begin(); 
02327          iter != fse->candidateFunctions->end(); ++iter) {
02328         // Loop over the set of candidate functions and try each one
02329         Symbol *candidateFunction = *iter;
02330         const FunctionType *ft = 
02331             dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(candidateFunction->type);
02332         assert(ft != NULL);
02333         const std::vector<const Type *> &funcArgTypes = ft->GetArgumentTypes();
02334         const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &argumentDefaults = ft->GetArgumentDefaults();
02335 
02336         // There's no way to match if the caller is passing more arguments
02337         // than this function instance takes.
02338         if (callArgs.size() > funcArgTypes.size())
02339             continue;
02340 
02341         unsigned int i;
02342         // Note that we're looping over the caller arguments, not the
02343         // function arguments; it may be ok to have more arguments to the
02344         // function than are passed, if the function has default argument
02345         // values.  This case is handled below.
02346         int cost = 0;
02347         for (i = 0; i < callArgs.size(); ++i) {
02348             // This may happen if there's an error earlier in compilation.
02349             // It's kind of a silly to redundantly discover this for each
02350             // potential match versus detecting this earlier in the
02351             // matching process and just giving up.
02352             if (!callArgs[i] || !callArgs[i]->GetType() || !funcArgTypes[i] ||
02353                 dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(callArgs[i]->GetType()) != NULL)
02354                 return false;
02355             
02356             int argCost = matchFunc(callArgs[i], funcArgTypes[i]);
02357             if (argCost == -1)
02358                 // If the predicate function returns -1, we have failed no
02359                 // matter what else happens, so we stop trying
02360                 break;
02361             cost += argCost;
02362         }
02363         if (i == callArgs.size()) {
02364             // All of the arguments matched!
02365             if (i == funcArgTypes.size())
02366                 // And we have exactly as many arguments as the function
02367                 // wants, so we're done.
02368                 matches.push_back(std::make_pair(cost, candidateFunction));
02369             else if (i < funcArgTypes.size() && argumentDefaults[i] != NULL)
02370                 // Otherwise we can still make it if there are default
02371                 // arguments for the rest of the arguments!  Because in
02372                 // Module::AddFunction() we have verified that once the
02373                 // default arguments start, then all of the following ones
02374                 // have them as well.  Therefore, we just need to check if
02375                 // the arg we stopped at has a default value and we're
02376                 // done.
02377                 matches.push_back(std::make_pair(cost, candidateFunction));
02378             // otherwise, we don't have a match
02379         }
02380     }
02381 
02382     if (matches.size() == 0)
02383         return false;
02384     else if ((fse->matchingFunc = lGetBestMatch(matches)) != NULL) {
02385         // We have a match--fill in with any default argument values
02386         // needed.
02387         const FunctionType *ft = 
02388             dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(fse->matchingFunc->type);
02389         assert(ft != NULL);
02390         const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &argumentDefaults = ft->GetArgumentDefaults();
02391         const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes = ft->GetArgumentTypes();
02392         assert(argumentDefaults.size() == argTypes.size());
02393         for (unsigned int i = callArgs.size(); i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
02394             assert(argumentDefaults[i] != NULL);
02395             args->exprs.push_back(argumentDefaults[i]);
02396         }
02397         return true;
02398     }
02399     else {
02400         Error(fse->pos, "Multiple overloaded instances of function \"%s\" matched.",
02401               funName);
02402         lPrintFunctionOverloads(funName, matches);
02403         lPrintPassedTypes(funName, args->exprs);
02404         // Stop trying to find more matches after failure
02405         return true;
02406     }
02407 }
02408 
02409 
02410 void
02411 FunctionCallExpr::resolveFunctionOverloads(bool exactMatchOnly) {
02412     FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
02413     if (!fse) 
02414         // error will be issued later if not calling an actual function
02415         return;
02416     assert(args);
02417     
02418     // Is there an exact match that doesn't require any argument type
02419     // conversion (other than converting type -> reference type)?
02420     if (tryResolve(lExactMatch))
02421         return;
02422 
02423     if (!exactMatchOnly) {
02424         // Try to find a single match ignoring references
02425         if (tryResolve(lMatchIgnoringReferences))
02426             return;
02427 
02428         // Try to find an exact match via type widening--i.e. int8 ->
02429         // int16, etc.--things that don't lose data.
02430         if (tryResolve(lMatchWithTypeWidening))
02431             return;
02432 
02433         // Next try to see if there's a match via just uniform -> varying
02434         // promotions.
02435         if (tryResolve(lMatchIgnoringUniform))
02436             return;
02437 
02438         // Try to find a match via type conversion, but don't change
02439         // unif->varying
02440         if (tryResolve(lMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability))
02441             return;
02442     
02443         // Last chance: try to find a match via arbitrary type conversion.
02444         if (tryResolve(lMatchWithTypeConv))
02445             return;
02446     }
02447 
02448     // failure :-(
02449     const char *funName = fse->candidateFunctions->front()->name.c_str();
02450     Error(pos, "Unable to find matching overload for call to function \"%s\"%s.",
02451           funName, exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "");
02452     lPrintFunctionOverloads(funName, *fse->candidateFunctions);
02453     lPrintPassedTypes(funName, args->exprs);
02454 }
02455 
02456 
02457 FunctionCallExpr::FunctionCallExpr(Expr *f, ExprList *a, SourcePos p, 
02458                                    bool il, Expr *lce) 
02459     : Expr(p), isLaunch(il) {
02460     func = f;
02461     args = a;
02462     launchCountExpr = lce;
02463 
02464     FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
02465     // Functions with names that start with "__" should only be various
02466     // builtins.  For those, we'll demand an exact match, since we'll
02467     // expect whichever function in stdlib.ispc is calling out to one of
02468     // those to be matching the argument types exactly; this is to be a bit
02469     // extra safe to be sure that the expected builtin is in fact being
02470     // called.
02471     bool exactMatchOnly = (fse != NULL) && (fse->name.substr(0,2) == "__");
02472     resolveFunctionOverloads(exactMatchOnly);
02473 }
02474 
02475 
02476 llvm::Value *
02477 FunctionCallExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02478     if (!func || !args)
02479         return NULL;
02480 
02481     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02482 
02483     FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
02484     if (!fse) {
02485         Error(pos, "No valid function available for function call.");
02486         return NULL;
02487     }
02488 
02489     if (!fse->matchingFunc) 
02490         // no overload match was found, get out of here..
02491         return NULL;
02492 
02493     Symbol *funSym = fse->matchingFunc;
02494     llvm::Function *callee = funSym->function;
02495     if (!callee) {
02496         Error(pos, "Symbol \"%s\" is not a function.", funSym->name.c_str());
02497         return NULL;
02498     }
02499 
02500     const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(funSym->type);
02501     assert(ft != NULL);
02502     bool isVoidFunc = (ft->GetReturnType() == AtomicType::Void);
02503 
02504     // Automatically convert function call args to references if needed.
02505     // FIXME: this should move to the TypeCheck() method... (but the
02506     // GetLValue call below needs a FunctionEmitContext, which is
02507     // problematic...)  
02508     std::vector<Expr *> callargs = args->exprs;
02509     const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes = ft->GetArgumentTypes();
02510     bool err = false;
02511     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
02512         Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
02513         if (!argExpr)
02514             continue;
02515 
02516         // All arrays should already have been converted to reference types
02517         assert(dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(argTypes[i]) == NULL);
02518 
02519         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(argTypes[i])) {
02520             if (!dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(argExpr->GetType())) {
02521                 // The function wants a reference type but the argument
02522                 // being passed isn't already a reference.
02523                 if (argExpr->GetLValue(ctx) == NULL) {
02524                     // If it doesn't have an lvalue, then we can't make it
02525                     // a reference, so issue an error.
02526                     // FIXME: for const reference parameters, we could
02527                     // store the expr's value to alloca'ed memory and then
02528                     // pass a reference to that...
02529                     Error(pos, "Can't pass non-lvalue as \"reference\" parameter \"%s\" "
02530                           "to function \"%s\".", ft->GetArgumentName(i).c_str(), 
02531                           funSym->name.c_str());
02532                     err = true;
02533                 }
02534                 else
02535                     argExpr = new ReferenceExpr(argExpr, argExpr->pos);
02536             }
02537         }
02538 
02539         // Do whatever type conversion is needed
02540         argExpr = argExpr->TypeConv(argTypes[i], "function call argument");
02541         // The function overload resolution code should have ensured that
02542         // we can successfully do any type conversions needed here.
02543         assert(argExpr != NULL);
02544         callargs[i] = argExpr;
02545     }
02546     if (err)
02547         return NULL;
02548 
02549     // Now evaluate the values of all of the parameters being passed.  We
02550     // need to evaluate these first here, since their GetValue() calls may
02551     // change the current basic block (e.g. if one of these is itself a
02552     // function call expr...); we need to basic blocks to stay consistent
02553     // below when we emit the code that does the actual funciton call.
02554     std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVals;
02555     std::vector<llvm::Value *> storedArgValPtrs, argValLValues;
02556     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
02557         Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
02558         if (!argExpr)
02559             // give up; we hit an error earlier
02560             return NULL;
02561 
02562         llvm::Value *argValue = argExpr->GetValue(ctx);
02563         if (!argValue)
02564             // something went wrong in evaluating the argument's
02565             // expression, so give up on this
02566             return NULL;
02567 
02568         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(argTypes[i]) &&
02569             !llvm::isa<const llvm::PointerType>(argValue->getType())) {
02570             assert(llvm::isa<const llvm::ArrayType>(argValue->getType()));
02571             // if the parameter is a reference and the lvalue needs a
02572             // gather to pull it together, then do the gather here and
02573             // store the result to local memory, so that we can pass the
02574             // single pointer to the local memory that is needed for the
02575             // reference.  Below, we'll copy the result back to the varying
02576             // lvalue pointer we have here.  (== pass by value/result)
02577             const ReferenceType *rt = 
02578                 dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(argExpr->GetType());
02579             assert(rt != NULL);
02580             const Type *type = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
02581 
02582             llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(type->LLVMType(g->ctx), "arg");
02583             llvm::Value *mask = lMaskForSymbol(argExpr->GetBaseSymbol(), ctx);
02584             llvm::Value *val = ctx->LoadInst(argValue, mask, type);
02585             ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
02586             storedArgValPtrs.push_back(ptr);
02587             argValLValues.push_back(argValue);
02588             argVals.push_back(ptr);
02589         }
02590         else {
02591             argVals.push_back(argValue);
02592             storedArgValPtrs.push_back(NULL);
02593             argValLValues.push_back(NULL);
02594         }
02595     }
02596 
02597     llvm::Value *retVal = NULL;
02598     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02599     if (ft->isTask) {
02600         assert(launchCountExpr != NULL);
02601         llvm::Value *launchCount = launchCountExpr->GetValue(ctx);
02602         if (launchCount != NULL)
02603             ctx->LaunchInst(callee, argVals, launchCount);
02604     }
02605     else {
02606         // Most of the time, the mask is passed as the last argument.  this
02607         // isn't the case for things like intrinsics, builtins, and extern
02608         // "C" functions from the application.
02609         assert(callargs.size() + 1 == callee->arg_size() ||
02610                callargs.size() == callee->arg_size());
02611 
02612         if (callargs.size() + 1 == callee->arg_size())
02613             argVals.push_back(ctx->GetFullMask());
02614 
02615         retVal = ctx->CallInst(callee, argVals, isVoidFunc ? "" : "calltmp");
02616     }
02617 
02618     // For anything we had to do as pass by value/result, copy the
02619     // corresponding reference values back out
02620     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < storedArgValPtrs.size(); ++i) {
02621         llvm::Value *ptr = storedArgValPtrs[i];
02622         if (ptr != NULL) {
02623             const ReferenceType *rt = 
02624                 dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callargs[i]->GetType());
02625             assert(rt != NULL);
02626             llvm::Value *load = ctx->LoadInst(ptr, NULL, rt->GetReferenceTarget(),
02627                                               "load_ref");
02628             Symbol *baseSym = callargs[i]->GetBaseSymbol();
02629             lStoreAssignResult(load, argValLValues[i], rt->GetReferenceTarget(),
02630                                ctx, baseSym);
02631         }
02632     }
02633 
02634     if (isVoidFunc)
02635         return NULL;
02636     else
02637         return retVal;
02638 }
02639 
02640 
02641 const Type *
02642 FunctionCallExpr::GetType() const {
02643     FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
02644     if (fse && fse->matchingFunc) {
02645         const FunctionType *ft = 
02646             dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(fse->matchingFunc->type);
02647         assert(ft != NULL);
02648         return ft->GetReturnType();
02649     }
02650     else
02651         return NULL;
02652 }
02653 
02654 
02655 Expr *
02656 FunctionCallExpr::Optimize() {
02657     if (func) 
02658         func = func->Optimize();
02659     if (args) 
02660         args = args->Optimize();
02661     if (!func || !args)
02662         return NULL;
02663         
02664     return this;
02665 }
02666 
02667 
02668 Expr *
02669 FunctionCallExpr::TypeCheck() {
02670     if (func) {
02671         func = func->TypeCheck();
02672         if (func != NULL) {
02673             const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(func->GetType());
02674             if (ft != NULL) {
02675                 if (ft->isTask) {
02676                     if (!isLaunch)
02677                         Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression needed to call function "
02678                               "with \"task\" qualifier.");
02679                     if (!launchCountExpr)
02680                         return NULL;
02681 
02682                     launchCountExpr = 
02683                         launchCountExpr->TypeConv(AtomicType::UniformInt32,
02684                                                   "task launch count");
02685                     if (!launchCountExpr)
02686                         return NULL;
02687                 }
02688                 else {
02689                     if (isLaunch)
02690                         Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression illegal with non-\"task\"-"
02691                               "qualified function.");
02692                     assert(launchCountExpr == NULL);
02693                 }
02694             }
02695             else
02696                 Error(pos, "Valid function name must be used for function call.");
02697         }
02698     }
02699 
02700     if (args) 
02701         args = args->TypeCheck();
02702 
02703     if (!func || !args)
02704         return NULL;
02705     return this;
02706 }
02707 
02708 
02709 int
02710 FunctionCallExpr::EstimateCost() const {
02711     return ((args ? args->EstimateCost() : 0) +
02712             (isLaunch ? COST_TASK_LAUNCH : COST_FUNCALL));
02713 }
02714 
02715 
02716 void
02717 FunctionCallExpr::Print() const {
02718     if (!func || !args || !GetType())
02719         return;
02720 
02721     printf("[%s] funcall %s ", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
02722            isLaunch ? "launch" : "");
02723     func->Print();
02724     printf(" args (");
02725     args->Print();
02726     printf(")");
02727     pos.Print();
02728 }
02729 
02730 
02731 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02732 // ExprList
02733 
02734 llvm::Value *
02735 ExprList::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02736     FATAL("ExprList::GetValue() should never be called");
02737     return NULL;
02738 }
02739 
02740 
02741 const Type *
02742 ExprList::GetType() const {
02743     FATAL("ExprList::GetType() should never be called");
02744     return NULL;
02745 }
02746 
02747 
02748 ExprList *
02749 ExprList::Optimize() {
02750     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i)
02751         if (exprs[i])
02752             exprs[i] = exprs[i]->Optimize();
02753     return this;
02754 }
02755 
02756 
02757 ExprList *
02758 ExprList::TypeCheck() {
02759     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i)
02760         if (exprs[i])
02761             exprs[i] = exprs[i]->TypeCheck();
02762     return this;
02763 }
02764 
02765 
02766 llvm::Constant *
02767 ExprList::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
02768     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
02769         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(type);
02770     if (collectionType == NULL)
02771         return NULL;
02772 
02773     std::string name;
02774     if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL)
02775         name = "struct";
02776     else if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) != NULL) 
02777         name = "array";
02778     else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type) != NULL) 
02779         name = "vector";
02780     else 
02781         FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in ExprList::GetConstant()");
02782 
02783     if ((int)exprs.size() != collectionType->GetElementCount()) {
02784         Error(pos, "Initializer list for %s \"%s\" must have %d elements "
02785               "(has %d).", name.c_str(), collectionType->GetString().c_str(),
02786               collectionType->GetElementCount(), (int)exprs.size());
02787         return NULL;
02788     }
02789 
02790     std::vector<llvm::Constant *> cv;
02791     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
02792         if (exprs[i] == NULL)
02793             return NULL;
02794         const Type *elementType = collectionType->GetElementType(i);
02795         llvm::Constant *c = exprs[i]->GetConstant(elementType);
02796         if (c == NULL)
02797             // If this list element couldn't convert to the right constant
02798             // type for the corresponding collection member, then give up.
02799             return NULL;
02800         cv.push_back(c);
02801     }
02802 
02803     if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL) {
02804 #if defined(LLVM_2_9)
02805         return llvm::ConstantStruct::get(*g->ctx, cv, false);
02806 #else
02807         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::StructType *llvmStructType =
02808             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::StructType>(collectionType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
02809         assert(llvmStructType != NULL);
02810         return llvm::ConstantStruct::get(llvmStructType, cv);
02811 #endif
02812     }
02813     else {
02814         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *lt = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
02815         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *lat = 
02816             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lt);
02817         // FIXME: should the assert below validly fail for uniform vectors
02818         // now?  Need a test case to reproduce it and then to be sure we
02819         // have the right fix; leave the assert until we can hit it...
02820         assert(lat != NULL);
02821         return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, cv);
02822     }
02823     return NULL;
02824 }
02825 
02826 
02827 int
02828 ExprList::EstimateCost() const {
02829     int cost = 0;
02830     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
02831         if (exprs[i] != NULL)
02832             cost += exprs[i]->EstimateCost();
02833     }
02834     return cost;
02835 }
02836 
02837 
02838 void
02839 ExprList::Print() const {
02840     printf("expr list (");
02841     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
02842         if (exprs[i] != NULL)
02843             exprs[i]->Print();
02844         printf("%s", (i == exprs.size() - 1) ? ")" : ", ");
02845     }
02846     pos.Print();
02847 }
02848 
02849 
02850 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02851 // IndexExpr
02852 
02853 IndexExpr::IndexExpr(Expr *a, Expr *i, SourcePos p) 
02854     : Expr(p) {
02855     arrayOrVector = a;
02856     index = i;
02857 }
02858 
02859 
02860 // FIXME: This is an ugly hack--if we're indexing into a uniform ispc
02861 // VectorType, then this bitcasts the corresponding llvm::VectorType value
02862 // to be a pointer to the vector's element type, so that a GEP to index
02863 // from the pointer indices elements of the llvm::VectorType and doesn't
02864 // incorrectly try to index into an array of llvm::VectorType instances.
02865 
02866 static llvm::Value *
02867 lCastUniformVectorBasePtr(llvm::Value *ptr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
02868     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *baseType = 
02869         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(ptr->getType());
02870     if (!baseType)
02871         return ptr;
02872 
02873     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *baseEltVecType = 
02874         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(baseType->getElementType());
02875     if (!baseEltVecType)
02876         return ptr;
02877 
02878     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *vecEltType = baseEltVecType->getElementType();
02879     int numElts = baseEltVecType->getNumElements();
02880     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *castType = 
02881         llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(vecEltType, numElts), 0);
02882     return ctx->BitCastInst(ptr, castType);
02883 }
02884 
02885 
02886 llvm::Value *
02887 IndexExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02888     const Type *arrayOrVectorType;
02889     if (arrayOrVector == NULL || index == NULL || 
02890         ((arrayOrVectorType = arrayOrVector->GetType()) == NULL))
02891         return NULL;
02892 
02893     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02894     llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
02895     llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
02896     if (lvalue == NULL) {
02897         // We may be indexing into a temporary that hasn't hit memory, so
02898         // get the full value and stuff it into temporary alloca'd space so
02899         // that we can index from there...
02900         llvm::Value *val = arrayOrVector->GetValue(ctx);
02901         if (val == NULL) {
02902             assert(m->errorCount > 0);
02903             return NULL;
02904         }
02905         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02906         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(arrayOrVectorType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
02907                                            "array_tmp");
02908         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
02909         ptr = lCastUniformVectorBasePtr(ptr, ctx);
02910         lvalue = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, LLVMInt32(0), index->GetValue(ctx));
02911         mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
02912     }
02913     else {
02914         Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
02915         assert(baseSym != NULL);
02916         mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
02917     }
02918 
02919     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02920     return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, GetType(), "index");
02921 }
02922 
02923 
02924 const Type *
02925 IndexExpr::GetType() const {
02926     const Type *arrayOrVectorType, *indexType;
02927     if (!arrayOrVector || !index || 
02928         ((arrayOrVectorType = arrayOrVector->GetType()) == NULL) ||
02929         ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
02930         return NULL;
02931 
02932     const SequentialType *sequentialType = 
02933         dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(arrayOrVectorType->GetReferenceTarget());
02934     // Typechecking should have caught this...
02935     assert(sequentialType != NULL);
02936 
02937     const Type *elementType = sequentialType->GetElementType();
02938     if (indexType->IsUniformType())
02939         // If the index is uniform, the resulting type is just whatever the
02940         // element type is
02941         return elementType;
02942     else
02943         // A varying index into uniform array/vector -> varying type (and
02944         // same for varying array of course...)
02945         return elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
02946 }
02947 
02948 
02949 Symbol *
02950 IndexExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
02951     return arrayOrVector ? arrayOrVector->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
02952 }
02953 
02954 
02955 llvm::Value *
02956 IndexExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02957     const Type *type;
02958     if (!arrayOrVector || !index || ((type = arrayOrVector->GetType()) == NULL))
02959         return NULL;
02960 
02961     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02962     llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
02963     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) ||
02964         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type))
02965         basePtr = arrayOrVector->GetLValue(ctx);
02966     else {
02967         type = type->GetReferenceTarget();
02968         assert(dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) ||
02969                dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type));
02970         basePtr = arrayOrVector->GetValue(ctx);
02971     }
02972     if (!basePtr)
02973         return NULL;
02974 
02975     // If the array index is a compile time constant, check to see if it
02976     // may lead to an out-of-bounds access.
02977     ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(index);
02978     const SequentialType *seqType = dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(type);
02979     assert(seqType != NULL);
02980     int nElements = seqType->GetElementCount();
02981     if (ce != NULL && nElements > 0) {
02982         int32_t indices[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
02983         int count = ce->AsInt32(indices);
02984         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
02985             if (indices[i] < 0 || indices[i] >= nElements)
02986                 Warning(index->pos, "Array index \"%d\" may be out of bounds for "
02987                         "\"%d\" element array.", indices[i], nElements);
02988         }
02989     }
02990 
02991     basePtr = lCastUniformVectorBasePtr(basePtr, ctx);
02992 
02993     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02994     return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, LLVMInt32(0), index->GetValue(ctx));
02995 }
02996 
02997 
02998 Expr *
02999 IndexExpr::Optimize() {
03000     if (arrayOrVector) 
03001         arrayOrVector = arrayOrVector->Optimize();
03002     if (index) 
03003         index = index->Optimize();
03004     if (arrayOrVector == NULL || index == NULL)
03005         return NULL;
03006 
03007     return this;
03008 }
03009 
03010 
03011 Expr *
03012 IndexExpr::TypeCheck() {
03013     if (arrayOrVector) 
03014         arrayOrVector = arrayOrVector->TypeCheck();
03015     if (index) 
03016         index = index->TypeCheck();
03017     
03018     if (!arrayOrVector || !index || !index->GetType())
03019         return NULL;
03020 
03021     const Type *arrayOrVectorType = arrayOrVector->GetType();
03022     if (!arrayOrVectorType)
03023         return NULL;
03024 
03025     if (dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(arrayOrVectorType->GetReferenceTarget()) == NULL) {
03026         Error(pos, "Trying to index into non-array or vector type \"%s\".", 
03027               arrayOrVectorType->GetString().c_str());
03028         return NULL;
03029     }
03030 
03031     bool isUniform = (index->GetType()->IsUniformType() && 
03032                       !g->opt.disableUniformMemoryOptimizations);
03033     const Type *indexType = isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 : 
03034                                         AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
03035     index = index->TypeConv(indexType, "array index");
03036     if (!index)
03037         return NULL;
03038 
03039     return this;
03040 }
03041 
03042 
03043 int
03044 IndexExpr::EstimateCost() const {
03045     // be pessimistic
03046     if (index && index->GetType()->IsVaryingType())
03047         return COST_GATHER;
03048     else
03049         return COST_LOAD;
03050 }
03051 
03052 
03053 void
03054 IndexExpr::Print() const {
03055     if (!arrayOrVector || !index || !GetType())
03056         return;
03057 
03058     printf("[%s] index ", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
03059     arrayOrVector->Print();
03060     printf("[");
03061     index->Print();
03062     printf("]");
03063     pos.Print();
03064 }
03065 
03066 
03067 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
03068 // MemberExpr
03069 
03070 /** Map one character ids to vector element numbers.  Allow a few different
03071     conventions--xyzw, rgba, uv.
03072  */
03073 static int
03074 lIdentifierToVectorElement(char id) {
03075     switch (id) {
03076     case 'x':
03077     case 'r':
03078     case 'u':
03079         return 0;
03080     case 'y':
03081     case 'g':
03082     case 'v':
03083         return 1;
03084     case 'z':
03085     case 'b':
03086         return 2;
03087     case 'w':
03088     case 'a':
03089         return 3;
03090     default:
03091         return -1;
03092     }
03093 }
03094 
03095 class StructMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
03096 {
03097 public:
03098     StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03099                      SourcePos idpos, const StructType* structType);
03100 
03101     const Type* GetType() const;
03102 
03103     int getElementNumber() const;
03104 
03105 private:
03106     const StructType* exprStructType;
03107 };
03108 
03109 StructMemberExpr::StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03110                                    SourcePos idpos,
03111                                    const StructType* structType)
03112     : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos), exprStructType(structType) {
03113 }
03114 
03115 const Type*
03116 StructMemberExpr::GetType() const {
03117     // It's a struct, and the result type is the element
03118     // type, possibly promoted to varying if the struct type / lvalue
03119     // is varying.
03120     const Type *elementType = exprStructType->GetElementType(identifier);
03121     if (!elementType)
03122         Error(identifierPos,
03123               "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
03124               identifier.c_str(), exprStructType->GetString().c_str(),
03125               getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
03126 
03127     if (exprStructType->IsVaryingType()) 
03128         return elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
03129     else
03130         return elementType;
03131 }
03132 
03133 int
03134 StructMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03135     int elementNumber = exprStructType->GetElementNumber(identifier);
03136     if (elementNumber == -1)
03137         Error(identifierPos,
03138               "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
03139               identifier.c_str(), exprStructType->GetString().c_str(),
03140               getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
03141     return elementNumber;
03142 }
03143 
03144 class VectorMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
03145 {
03146 public:
03147     VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03148                      SourcePos idpos, const VectorType* vectorType);
03149 
03150     ~VectorMemberExpr();
03151 
03152     const Type* GetType() const;
03153 
03154     llvm::Value* GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
03155 
03156     llvm::Value* GetValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
03157 
03158     int getElementNumber() const;
03159 private:
03160     const VectorType* exprVectorType;
03161     const VectorType* memberType;
03162 };
03163 
03164 VectorMemberExpr::VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03165                                    SourcePos idpos,
03166                                    const VectorType* vectorType)
03167     : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos), exprVectorType(vectorType) {
03168     memberType = new VectorType(exprVectorType->GetElementType(),
03169                                 identifier.length());
03170 }
03171 
03172 VectorMemberExpr::~VectorMemberExpr() {
03173     delete memberType;
03174 }
03175 
03176 const Type*
03177 VectorMemberExpr::GetType() const {
03178     // For 1-element expressions, we have the base vector element
03179     // type.  For n-element expressions, we have a shortvec type
03180     // with n > 1 elements.  This can be changed when we get
03181     // type<1> -> type conversions.
03182     if (identifier.length() == 1) {
03183         return exprVectorType->GetElementType();
03184     } else {
03185         return memberType;
03186     }
03187 }
03188 
03189 
03190 llvm::Value*
03191 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const {
03192     if (identifier.length() == 1) {
03193         return MemberExpr::GetLValue(ctx);
03194     } else {
03195         return NULL;
03196     }
03197 }
03198 
03199 
03200 llvm::Value*
03201 VectorMemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const {
03202     if (identifier.length() == 1) {
03203         return MemberExpr::GetValue(ctx);
03204     } else {
03205         std::vector<int> indices;
03206 
03207         for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
03208             int idx = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[i]);
03209             if (idx == -1)
03210                 Error(pos,
03211                       "Invalid swizzle charcter '%c' in swizzle \"%s\".",
03212                       identifier[i], identifier.c_str());
03213 
03214             indices.push_back(idx);
03215         }
03216 
03217         llvm::Value *basePtr = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
03218         if (basePtr == NULL) {
03219             assert(m->errorCount > 0);
03220             return NULL;
03221         }
03222         llvm::Value *ltmp = ctx->AllocaInst(memberType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
03223                                             "vector_tmp");
03224 
03225         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03226         for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
03227             llvm::Value *ptmp =
03228                 ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ltmp, 0, i, "new_offset");
03229             llvm::Value *initLValue =
03230                 ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr , 0,
03231                                        indices[i], "orig_offset");
03232             llvm::Value *initValue =
03233                 ctx->LoadInst(initLValue, NULL, memberType->GetElementType(),
03234                               "vec_element");
03235             ctx->StoreInst(initValue, ptmp);
03236         }
03237 
03238         return ctx->LoadInst(ltmp, NULL, memberType, "swizzle_vec");
03239     }
03240 }
03241 
03242 int
03243 VectorMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03244     int elementNumber = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[0]);
03245     if (elementNumber == -1)
03246         Error(pos, "Vector element identifier \"%s\" unknown.", 
03247               identifier.c_str());
03248     return elementNumber;
03249 }
03250 
03251 class ReferenceMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
03252 {
03253 public:
03254     ReferenceMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03255                         SourcePos idpos, const ReferenceType* referenceType);
03256 
03257     const Type* GetType() const;
03258 
03259     int getElementNumber() const;
03260 
03261     llvm::Value* GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
03262 
03263 private:
03264     const ReferenceType* exprReferenceType;
03265     MemberExpr* dereferencedExpr;
03266 };
03267 
03268 ReferenceMemberExpr::ReferenceMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03269                                          SourcePos idpos,
03270                                          const ReferenceType* referenceType)
03271     : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos), exprReferenceType(referenceType) {
03272     const Type* refTarget = exprReferenceType->GetReferenceTarget();
03273     const StructType* structType
03274         = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(refTarget);
03275     const VectorType* vectorType
03276         = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(refTarget);
03277 
03278     if (structType != NULL) {
03279         dereferencedExpr = new StructMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, structType);
03280     } else if (vectorType != NULL) {
03281         dereferencedExpr = new VectorMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, vectorType);
03282     } else {
03283         dereferencedExpr = NULL;
03284     }
03285 }
03286 
03287 const Type*
03288 ReferenceMemberExpr::GetType() const {
03289     if (dereferencedExpr == NULL) {
03290         Error(pos, "Can't access member of non-struct/vector type \"%s\".",
03291               exprReferenceType->GetString().c_str());
03292         return NULL;
03293     } else {
03294         return dereferencedExpr->GetType();
03295     }
03296 }
03297 
03298 int
03299 ReferenceMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03300     if (dereferencedExpr == NULL) {
03301         // FIXME: I think we shouldn't ever get here and that
03302         // typechecking should have caught this case
03303         return -1;
03304     } else {
03305         return dereferencedExpr->getElementNumber();
03306     }
03307 }
03308 
03309 llvm::Value*
03310 ReferenceMemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const {
03311     if (dereferencedExpr == NULL) {
03312         // FIXME: again I think typechecking should have caught this
03313         Error(pos, "Can't access member of non-struct/vector type \"%s\".",
03314               exprReferenceType->GetString().c_str());
03315         return NULL;
03316     }
03317 
03318     //FIXME: Minor Code-dup...this is the same as the base, except
03319     // llvm::Value *basePtr = expr->GetLValue instead of expr->getValue
03320     llvm::Value *basePtr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
03321     if (!basePtr)
03322         return NULL;
03323 
03324     int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
03325     if (elementNumber == -1)
03326         return NULL;
03327 
03328     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03329     return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, 0, elementNumber);
03330 }
03331 
03332 
03333 MemberExpr*
03334 MemberExpr::create(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos) {
03335     const Type* exprType;
03336     if (e == NULL || (exprType = e->GetType()) == NULL)
03337         return new MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos);
03338 
03339     const StructType* structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType*>(exprType);
03340     if (structType != NULL)
03341         return new StructMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, structType);
03342 
03343     const VectorType* vectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType*>(exprType);
03344     if (vectorType != NULL)
03345         return new VectorMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, vectorType);
03346 
03347     const ReferenceType* referenceType = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType*>(exprType);
03348     if (referenceType != NULL)
03349         return new ReferenceMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, referenceType);
03350   
03351     return new MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos);
03352 }
03353 
03354 
03355 MemberExpr::MemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos) 
03356     : Expr(p), identifierPos(idpos) {
03357     expr = e;
03358     identifier = id;
03359 }
03360 
03361 
03362 llvm::Value *
03363 MemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03364     if (!expr) 
03365         return NULL;
03366 
03367     llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
03368     llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
03369     if (lvalue == NULL) {
03370         // As in the array case, this may be a temporary that hasn't hit
03371         // memory; get the full value and stuff it into a temporary array
03372         // so that we can index from there...
03373         llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
03374         if (!val) {
03375             assert(m->errorCount > 0);
03376             return NULL;
03377         }
03378         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03379         const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
03380         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
03381                                            "struct_tmp");
03382         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
03383 
03384         int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
03385         if (elementNumber == -1)
03386             return NULL;
03387         lvalue = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, 0, elementNumber);
03388         mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
03389     }
03390     else {
03391         Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
03392         assert(baseSym != NULL);
03393         mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
03394     }
03395 
03396     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03397     return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, GetType(), "structelement");
03398 }
03399 
03400 
03401 const Type *
03402 MemberExpr::GetType() const {
03403     return NULL;
03404 }
03405 
03406 
03407 Symbol *
03408 MemberExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
03409     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
03410 }
03411 
03412 
03413 int
03414 MemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03415     return -1;
03416 }
03417 
03418 
03419 llvm::Value *
03420 MemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03421     //This kindof feels like magic, but this functionality
03422     // will have to be overridden in VectorMemberExpr when
03423     // we support multi-swizzle.
03424     const Type *exprType;
03425     if (!expr || ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL))
03426         return NULL;
03427 
03428     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03429     llvm::Value *basePtr = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
03430     if (!basePtr)
03431         return NULL;
03432 
03433     int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
03434     if (elementNumber == -1)
03435         return NULL;
03436 
03437     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03438     return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, 0, elementNumber);
03439 }
03440 
03441 
03442 Expr *
03443 MemberExpr::TypeCheck() {
03444     if (expr) 
03445         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
03446     return expr ? this : NULL;
03447 }
03448 
03449 
03450 Expr *
03451 MemberExpr::Optimize() {
03452     if (expr) 
03453         expr = expr->Optimize();
03454     return expr ? this : NULL;
03455 }
03456 
03457 
03458 int
03459 MemberExpr::EstimateCost() const {
03460     // FIXME: return gather cost when we can tell a gather is going to be
03461     // needed
03462     return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
03463 }
03464 
03465 
03466 void
03467 MemberExpr::Print() const {
03468     if (!expr || !GetType())
03469         return;
03470 
03471     printf("[%s] member (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
03472     expr->Print();
03473     printf(" . %s)", identifier.c_str());
03474     pos.Print();
03475 }
03476 
03477 
03478 /** There is no structure member with the name we've got in "identifier".
03479     Use the approximate string matching routine to see if the identifier is
03480     a minor misspelling of one of the ones that is there.
03481  */
03482 std::string
03483 MemberExpr::getCandidateNearMatches() const {
03484     const StructType *structType = 
03485         dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(expr->GetType());
03486     if (!structType)
03487         return "";
03488 
03489     std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
03490     for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i)
03491         elementNames.push_back(structType->GetElementName(i));
03492     std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(identifier, elementNames);
03493     if (!alternates.size())
03494         return "";
03495 
03496     std::string ret = " Did you mean ";
03497     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
03498         ret += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
03499         if (i < alternates.size() - 1) ret += ", or ";
03500     }
03501     ret += "?";
03502     return ret;
03503 }
03504

03509 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t i, SourcePos p) 
03510   : Expr(p) {
03511     type = t;
03512     type = type->GetAsConstType();
03513     assert(type == AtomicType::UniformConstInt8);
03514     int8Val[0] = i;
03515 }

03521     type = type->GetAsConstType();
03522     assert(type == AtomicType::UniformConstInt8 || 
03523            type == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt8);
03524     for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
03525         int8Val[j] = i[j];
03526 }

03720 
03721 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, bool *b, SourcePos p) 
03722   : Expr(p) {
03723     type = t;
03724     type = type->GetAsConstType();
03725     assert(type == AtomicType::UniformConstBool || 
03726            type == AtomicType::VaryingConstBool);
03727     for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
03728         boolVal[j] = b[j];
03729 }
03730 
03731 
03732 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, double *v) 
03733     : Expr(old->pos) {
03734     type = old->type;
03735 
03736     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
03737 
03738     switch (basicType) {
03739     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
03740         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03741             boolVal[i] = (v[i] != 0.);
03742         break;
03743     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
03744         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03745             int8Val[i] = (int)v[i];
03746         break;
03747     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
03748         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03749             uint8Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
03750         break;
03751     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
03752         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03753             int16Val[i] = (int)v[i];
03754         break;
03755     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
03756         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03757             uint16Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
03758         break;
03759     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
03760         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03761             int32Val[i] = (int)v[i];
03762         break;
03763     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
03764         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03765             uint32Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
03766         break;
03767     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
03768         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03769             floatVal[i] = (float)v[i];
03770         break;
03771     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
03772         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
03773             doubleVal[i] = v[i];
03774         break;
03775     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
03776     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
03777         // For now, this should never be reached 
03778         FATAL("fixme; we need another constructor so that we're not trying to pass "
03779                "double values to init an int64 type...");
03780     default:
03781         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
03782     }
03783 }
03784 
03785 
03786 AtomicType::BasicType
03787 ConstExpr::getBasicType() const {
03788     const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
03789     if (at != NULL)
03790         return at->basicType;
03791     else {
03792         assert(dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL);
03793         return AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
03794     }
03795 }
03796 
03797 
03798 const Type *
03799 ConstExpr::GetType() const { 
03800     return type; 
03801 }
03802 
03803 
03804 llvm::Value *
03805 ConstExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03806     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03807     bool isVarying = type->IsVaryingType();
03808 
03809     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
03810 
03811     switch (basicType) {
03812     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
03813         if (isVarying)
03814             return LLVMBoolVector(boolVal);
03815         else
03816             return boolVal[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
03817     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
03818         return isVarying ? LLVMInt8Vector(int8Val) : 
03819                            LLVMInt8(int8Val[0]);
03820     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
03821         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt8Vector(uint8Val) : 
03822                            LLVMUInt8(uint8Val[0]);
03823     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
03824         return isVarying ? LLVMInt16Vector(int16Val) : 
03825                            LLVMInt16(int16Val[0]);
03826     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
03827         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt16Vector(uint16Val) : 
03828                            LLVMUInt16(uint16Val[0]);
03829     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
03830         return isVarying ? LLVMInt32Vector(int32Val) : 
03831                            LLVMInt32(int32Val[0]);
03832     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
03833         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32Val) : 
03834                            LLVMUInt32(uint32Val[0]);
03835     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
03836         return isVarying ? LLVMFloatVector(floatVal) : 
03837                            LLVMFloat(floatVal[0]);
03838     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
03839         return isVarying ? LLVMInt64Vector(int64Val) : 
03840                            LLVMInt64(int64Val[0]);
03841     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
03842         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64Val) : 
03843                            LLVMUInt64(uint64Val[0]);
03844     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
03845         return isVarying ? LLVMDoubleVector(doubleVal) : 
03846                            LLVMDouble(doubleVal[0]);
03847     default:
03848         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
03849         return NULL;
03850     }
03851 }
03852 
03853 
03854 /* Type conversion templates: take advantage of C++ function overloading
03855    rules to get the one we want to match. */
03856 
03857 /* First the most general case, just use C++ type conversion if nothing
03858    else matches */
03859 template <typename From, typename To> static inline void
03860 lConvertElement(From from, To *to) {
03861     *to = (To)from;
03862 }
03863 
03864 
03865 /** When converting from bool types to numeric types, make sure the result
03866     is one or zero.
03867     FIXME: this is a different rule than we use elsewhere, where we sign extend
03868     the bool.  We should fix the other case to just zero extend and then
03869     patch up places in the stdlib that depend on sign extension to call a 
03870     routine to make that happen.
03871  */ 
03872 template <typename To> static inline void
03873 lConvertElement(bool from, To *to) {
03874     *to = from ? (To)1 : (To)0;
03875 }
03876 
03877 
03878 /** When converting numeric types to bool, compare to zero.  (Do we
03879     actually need this one??) */
03880 template <typename From> static inline void
03881 lConvertElement(From from, bool *to) {
03882     *to = (from != 0);
03883 }
03884 
03885 
03886 /** And bool -> bool is just assignment */
03887 static inline void
03888 lConvertElement(bool from, bool *to) {
03889     *to = from;
03890 }
03891 
03892 
03893 /** Type conversion utility function
03894  */
03895 template <typename From, typename To> static void
03896 lConvert(const From *from, To *to, int count, bool forceVarying) {
03897     for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
03898         lConvertElement(from[i], &to[i]);
03899 
03900     if (forceVarying && count == 1)
03901         for (int i = 1; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
03902             to[i] = to[0];
03903 }
03904 
03905 
03906 int
03907 ConstExpr::AsInt64(int64_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
03908     switch (getBasicType()) {
03909     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:   lConvert(boolVal,   ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03910     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:   lConvert(int8Val,   ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03911     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:  lConvert(uint8Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03912     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:  lConvert(int16Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03913     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03914     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:  lConvert(int32Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03915     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03916     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:  lConvert(floatVal,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03917     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03918     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:  lConvert(int64Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03919     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03920     default:
03921         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
03922     }
03923     return Count();
03924 }

03940     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
03941     default:
