04116 int
04117 ConstExpr::AsUInt32(uint32_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
04118     switch (getBasicType()) {
04119     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:   lConvert(boolVal,   up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04120     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:   lConvert(int8Val,   up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04121     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:  lConvert(uint8Val,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04122     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:  lConvert(int16Val,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04123     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04124     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:  lConvert(int32Val,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04125     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04126     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:  lConvert(floatVal,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04127     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04128     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:  lConvert(int64Val,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04129     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04130     default:
04131         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04132     }
04133     return Count();
04134 }
04135 
04136 
04137 int
04138 ConstExpr::Count() const { 
04139     return GetType()->IsVaryingType() ? g->target.vectorWidth : 1; 
04140 }
04141 
04142 
04143 llvm::Constant *
04144 ConstExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
04145     // Caller shouldn't be trying to stuff a varying value here into a
04146     // constant type.
04147     if (type->IsUniformType())
04148         assert(Count() == 1);
04149 
04150     type = type->GetAsNonConstType();
04151     if (type == AtomicType::UniformBool || type == AtomicType::VaryingBool) {
04152         bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04153         AsBool(bv, type->IsVaryingType());
04154         if (type->IsUniformType())
04155             return bv[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
04156         else
04157             return LLVMBoolVector(bv);
04158     }
04159     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt8 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt8) {
04160         int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04161         AsInt8(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04162         if (type->IsUniformType())
04163             return LLVMInt8(iv[0]);
04164         else
04165             return LLVMInt8Vector(iv);
04166     }
04167     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt8 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt8 ||
04168              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
04169         uint8_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04170         AsUInt8(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04171         if (type->IsUniformType())
04172             return LLVMUInt8(uiv[0]);
04173         else
04174             return LLVMUInt8Vector(uiv);
04175     }
04176     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt16 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt16) {
04177         int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04178         AsInt16(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04179         if (type->IsUniformType())
04180             return LLVMInt16(iv[0]);
04181         else
04182             return LLVMInt16Vector(iv);
04183     }
04184     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt16 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt16 ||
04185              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
04186         uint16_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04187         AsUInt16(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04188         if (type->IsUniformType())
04189             return LLVMUInt16(uiv[0]);
04190         else
04191             return LLVMUInt16Vector(uiv);
04192     }
04193     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt32) {
04194         int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04195         AsInt32(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04196         if (type->IsUniformType())
04197             return LLVMInt32(iv[0]);
04198         else
04199             return LLVMInt32Vector(iv);
04200     }
04201     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
04202              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
04203         uint32_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04204         AsUInt32(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04205         if (type->IsUniformType())
04206             return LLVMUInt32(uiv[0]);
04207         else
04208             return LLVMUInt32Vector(uiv);
04209     }
04210     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformFloat || type == AtomicType::VaryingFloat) {
04211         float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04212         AsFloat(fv, type->IsVaryingType());
04213         if (type->IsUniformType())
04214             return LLVMFloat(fv[0]);
04215         else
04216             return LLVMFloatVector(fv);
04217     }
04218     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt64 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt64) {
04219         int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04220         AsInt64(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04221         if (type->IsUniformType())
04222             return LLVMInt64(iv[0]);
04223         else
04224             return LLVMInt64Vector(iv);
04225     }
04226     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt64 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) {
04227         uint64_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04228         AsUInt64(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04229         if (type->IsUniformType())
04230             return LLVMUInt64(uiv[0]);
04231         else
04232             return LLVMUInt64Vector(uiv);
04233     }
04234     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformDouble || type == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) {
04235         double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04236         AsDouble(dv, type->IsVaryingType());
04237         if (type->IsUniformType())
04238             return LLVMDouble(dv[0]);
04239         else
04240             return LLVMDoubleVector(dv);
04241     }
04242     else {
04243         FATAL("unexpected type in ConstExpr::GetConstant()");
04244         return NULL;
04245     }
04246 }
04247 
04248 
04249 Expr *
04250 ConstExpr::Optimize() {
04251     return this;
04252 }
04253 
04254 
04255 Expr *
04256 ConstExpr::TypeCheck() {
04257     return this;
04258 }
04259 
04260 
04261 int
04262 ConstExpr::EstimateCost() const {
04263     return 0;
04264 }
04265 
04266 
04267 void
04268 ConstExpr::Print() const {
04269     printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
04270     for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i) {
04271         switch (getBasicType()) {
04272         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04273             printf("%s", boolVal[i] ? "true" : "false");
04274             break;
04275         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04276             printf("%d", (int)int8Val[i]);
04277             break;
04278         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04279             printf("%u", (int)uint8Val[i]);
04280             break;
04281         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04282             printf("%d", (int)int16Val[i]);
04283             break;
04284         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04285             printf("%u", (int)uint16Val[i]);
04286             break;
04287         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04288             printf("%d", int32Val[i]);
04289             break;
04290         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04291             printf("%u", uint32Val[i]);
04292             break;
04293         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04294             printf("%f", floatVal[i]);
04295             break;
04296         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04297 #ifdef ISPC_IS_LINUX
04298             printf("%ld", int64Val[i]);
04299 #else
04300             printf("%lld", int64Val[i]);
04301 #endif
04302             break;
04303         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04304 #ifdef ISPC_IS_LINUX
04305             printf("%lu", uint64Val[i]);
04306 #else
04307             printf("%llu", uint64Val[i]);
04308 #endif
04309             break;
04310         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04311             printf("%f", doubleVal[i]);
04312             break;
04313         default:
04314             FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04315         }
04316         if (i != Count() - 1)
04317             printf(", ");
04318     }
04319     printf(")");
04320     pos.Print();
04321 }
04322 
04323 
04324 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
04325 // TypeCastExpr
04326 
04327 TypeCastExpr::TypeCastExpr(const Type *t, Expr *e, SourcePos p) 
04328   : Expr(p) {
04329     type = t;
04330     expr = e;
04331 }
04332 
04333 
04334 /** Handle all the grungy details of type conversion between atomic types.
04335     Given an input value in exprVal of type fromType, convert it to the
04336     llvm::Value with type toType.
04337  */
04338 static llvm::Value *
04339 lTypeConvAtomic(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *exprVal, 
04340                 const AtomicType *toType, const AtomicType *fromType,
04341                 SourcePos pos) {
04342     llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
04343 
04344     switch (toType->basicType) {
04345     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
04346         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04347             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::FloatType : 
04348                                         LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
04349         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04350         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04351             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04352                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04353                 // If we have a bool vector of i32 elements, first truncate
04354                 // down to a single bit
04355                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04356             // And then do an unisgned int->float cast
04357             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
04358                                  exprVal, targetType, "bool2float");
04359             break;
04360         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04361         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04362         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04363         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04364             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int to float
04365                                  exprVal, targetType, "int2float");
04366             break;
04367         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04368         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04369         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04370         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04371             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04372                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from unsigned int to float is slow. "
04373                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04374             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to float
04375                                  exprVal, targetType, "uint2float");
04376             break;
04377         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04378             // No-op cast.
04379             cast = exprVal;
04380             break;
04381         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04382             cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, "double2float");
04383             break;
04384         default:
04385             FATAL("unimplemented");
04386         }
04387         break;
04388     }
04389     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
04390         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04391             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType :
04392                                         LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
04393         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04394         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04395             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04396                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04397                 // truncate i32 bool vector values to i1s
04398                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04399             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to double
04400                                  exprVal, targetType, "bool2double");
04401             break;
04402         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04403         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04404         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04405         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04406             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int
04407                                  exprVal, targetType, "int2double");
04408             break;
04409         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04410         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04411         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04412         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04413             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
04414                                  exprVal, targetType, "uint2double");
04415             break;
04416         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04417             cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, "float2double");
04418             break;
04419         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04420             cast = exprVal;
04421             break;
04422         default:
04423             FATAL("unimplemented");
04424         }
04425         break;
04426     }
04427     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
04428         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04429             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
04430                                         LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
04431         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04432         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04433             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04434                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04435                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04436             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int");
04437             break;
04438         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04439         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04440             cast = exprVal;
04441             break;
04442         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04443         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04444         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04445         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04446         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04447         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04448             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_int8");
04449             break;
04450         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04451             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04452                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int");
04453             break;
04454         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04455             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04456                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int");
04457             break;
04458         default:
04459             FATAL("unimplemented");
04460         }
04461         break;
04462     }
04463     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
04464         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04465             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
04466                                         LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
04467         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04468         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04469             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04470                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04471                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04472             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint");
04473             break;
04474         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04475         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04476             cast = exprVal;
04477             break;
04478         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04479         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04480         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04481         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04482         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04483         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04484             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_uint8");
04485             break;
04486         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04487             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04488                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
04489                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04490             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04491                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04492             break;
04493         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04494             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04495                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
04496                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04497             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04498                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
04499             break;
04500         default:
04501             FATAL("unimplemented");
04502         }
04503         break;
04504     }
04505     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
04506         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04507             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
04508                                         LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
04509         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04510         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04511             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04512                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04513                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04514             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int");
04515             break;
04516         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04517             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int2int16");
04518             break;
04519         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04520             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint16");
04521             break;
04522         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04523         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04524             cast = exprVal;
04525             break;
04526         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04527             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04528                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int");
04529             break;
04530         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04531         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04532         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04533         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04534             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_int16");
04535             break;
04536         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04537             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04538                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int");
04539             break;
04540         default:
04541             FATAL("unimplemented");
04542         }
04543         break;
04544     }
04545     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
04546         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04547             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
04548                                         LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
04549         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04550         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04551             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04552                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04553                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04554             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint16");
04555             break;
04556         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04557             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint16");
04558             break;
04559         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04560             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint16");
04561             break;            
04562         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04563         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04564             cast = exprVal;
04565             break;
04566         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04567             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04568                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
04569                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04570             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04571                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04572             break;
04573         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04574         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04575         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04576         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04577             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_uint16");
04578             break;
04579         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04580             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04581                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
04582                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04583             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04584                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
04585             break;
04586         default:
04587             FATAL("unimplemented");
04588         }
04589         break;
04590     }
04591     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
04592         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04593             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
04594                                         LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
04595         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04596         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04597             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04598                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04599                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04600             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int");
04601             break;
04602         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04603         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04604             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int2int32");
04605             break;
04606         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04607         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04608             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint32");
04609             break;
04610         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04611         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04612             cast = exprVal;
04613             break;
04614         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04615             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04616                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int");
04617             break;
04618         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04619         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04620             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_int32");
04621             break;
04622         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04623             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04624                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int");
04625             break;
04626         default:
04627             FATAL("unimplemented");
04628         }
04629         break;
04630     }
04631     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
04632         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04633             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
04634                                         LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
04635         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04636         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04637             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04638                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04639                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04640             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint");
04641             break;
04642         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04643         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04644             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint");
04645             break;
04646         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04647         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04648             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint");
04649             break;            
04650         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04651         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04652             cast = exprVal;
04653             break;
04654         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04655             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04656                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
04657                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04658             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04659                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04660             break;
04661         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04662         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04663             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_uint32");
04664             break;
04665         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04666             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04667                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
04668                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04669             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04670                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
04671             break;
04672         default:
04673             FATAL("unimplemented");
04674         }
04675         break;
04676     }
04677     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
04678         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04679             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : 
04680                                         LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
04681         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04682         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04683             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
04684                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04685                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04686             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int64");
04687             break;
04688         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04689         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04690         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04691             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int_to_int64");
04692             break;
04693         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04694         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04695         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04696             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint_to_int64");
04697             break;
04698         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04699             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04700                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int64");
04701             break;
04702         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04703         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04704             cast = exprVal;
04705             break;
04706         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04707             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04708                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int64");
04709             break;
04710         default:
04711             FATAL("unimplemented");
04712         }
04713         break;
04714     }
04715     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
04716         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04717             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : 
04718                                         LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
04719         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04720         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04721             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04722                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04723                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04724             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint");
04725             break;
04726         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04727         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04728         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04729             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int_to_uint64");
04730             break;
04731         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04732         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04733         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04734             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint_to_uint64");
04735             break;
04736         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04737             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04738                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int64 is slow. "
04739                                    "Use \"int64\" if possible");
04740             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
04741                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04742             break;
04743         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04744         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04745             cast = exprVal;
04746             break;
04747         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04748             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04749                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int64 is slow. "
04750                                    "Use \"int64\" if possible");
04751             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
04752                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
04753             break;
04754         default:
04755             FATAL("unimplemented");
04756         }
04757         break;
04758     }
04759     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
04760         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04761         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04762             cast = exprVal;
04763             break;
04764         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04765         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
04766             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8(0) : 
04767                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8Vector((int8_t)0);
04768             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
04769                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
04770             break;
04771         }
04772         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04773         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
04774             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16(0) : 
04775                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16Vector((int16_t)0);
04776             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
04777                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
04778             break;
04779         }
04780         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04781         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
04782             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32(0) : 
04783                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32Vector(0);
04784             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
04785                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
04786             break;
04787         }
04788         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
04789             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloat(0.f) : 
04790                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloatVector(0.f);
04791             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
04792                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpf0");
04793             break;
04794         }
04795         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04796         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
04797             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64(0) : 
04798                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64Vector((int64_t)0);
04799             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
04800                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
04801             break;
04802         }
04803         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
04804             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMDouble(0.) : 
04805                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMDoubleVector(0.);
04806             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
04807                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpd0");
04808             break;
04809         }
04810         default:
04811             FATAL("unimplemented");
04812         }
04813 
04814         if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
04815             if (toType->IsVaryingType() && 
04816                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
04817                 // extend out to i32 bool values from i1 here.  then we'll
04818                 // turn into a vector below, the way it does for everyone
04819                 // else...
04820                 cast = ctx->SExtInst(cast, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType->getElementType(),
04821                                      "i1bool_to_i32bool");
04822             }
04823         }
04824         else
04825             // fromType->IsVaryingType())
04826             cast = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cast);
04827 
04828         break;
04829     }
04830     default:
04831         FATAL("unimplemented");
04832     }
04833 
04834     // If we also want to go from uniform to varying, replicate out the
04835     // value across the vector elements..
04836     if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType()) {
04837         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *vtype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
04838         llvm::Value *castVec = llvm::UndefValue::get(vtype);
04839         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
04840             castVec = ctx->InsertInst(castVec, cast, i, "smearinsert");
04841         return castVec;
04842     }
04843     else
04844         return cast;
04845 }
04846 
04847 
04848 /** Converts the given value of the given type to be the varying
04849     equivalent, returning the resulting value.
04850  */
04851 static llvm::Value *
04852 lUniformValueToVarying(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *value,
04853                        const Type *type) {
04854     // nothing to do if it's already varying
04855     if (type->IsVaryingType())
04856         return value;
04857 
04858     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType = type->GetAsVaryingType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
04859     llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(llvmType);
04860 
04861     // for structs/arrays/vectors, just recursively make their elements
04862     // varying (if needed) and populate the return value.
04863     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
04864         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(type);
04865     if (collectionType != NULL) {
04866         for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
04867             llvm::Value *v = ctx->ExtractInst(value, i, "get_element");
04868             v = lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, v, collectionType->GetElementType(i));
04869             retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, v, i, "set_element");
04870         }
04871         return retValue;
04872     }
04873 
04874     // Otherwise we must have a uniform AtomicType, so smear its value
04875     // across the vector lanes.
04876     assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL);
04877     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
04878         retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, value, i, "smearinsert");
04879     return retValue;
04880 }
04881 
04882 
04883 
04884 llvm::Value *
04885 TypeCastExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
04886     if (!expr)
04887         return NULL;
04888 
04889     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
04890     const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
04891     if (!toType || !fromType || toType == AtomicType::Void || 
04892         fromType == AtomicType::Void)
04893         // an error should have been issued elsewhere in this case
04894         return NULL;
04895 
04896     if (Type::Equal(toType->GetAsConstType(), fromType->GetAsConstType()))
04897         // There's nothing to do, just return the value.  (LLVM's type
04898         // system doesn't worry about constiness.)
04899         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
04900 
04901     // This also should be caught during typechecking
04902     assert(!(toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()));
04903 
04904     const ReferenceType *toReference = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(toType);
04905     const ReferenceType *fromReference = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(fromType);
04906     if (toReference && fromReference) {
04907         const Type *toTarget = toReference->GetReferenceTarget();
04908         const Type *fromTarget = fromReference->GetReferenceTarget();
04909 
04910         const ArrayType *toArray = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toTarget);
04911         const ArrayType *fromArray = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromTarget);
04912         if (toArray && fromArray) {
04913             // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
04914             // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
04915             if(toArray->GetElementCount() != 0 && 
04916                (toArray->GetElementCount() != fromArray->GetElementCount()))
04917                 Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
04918                         fromArray->GetElementCount(), toArray->GetElementCount());
04919             assert(Type::Equal(toArray->GetBaseType()->GetAsConstType(),
04920                                fromArray->GetBaseType()->GetAsConstType()));
04921             llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
04922             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
04923             return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
04924         }
04925 
04926         assert(Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget) ||
04927                Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget->GetAsConstType()));
04928         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
04929     }
04930 
04931     const StructType *toStruct = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(toType);
04932     const StructType *fromStruct = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(fromType);
04933     if (toStruct && fromStruct) {
04934         // The only legal type conversions for structs are to go from a
04935         // uniform to a varying instance of the same struct type.
04936         assert(toStruct->IsVaryingType() && fromStruct->IsUniformType() &&
04937                Type::Equal(toStruct, fromStruct->GetAsVaryingType()));
04938 
04939         llvm::Value *origValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
04940         if (!origValue)
04941             return NULL;
04942         return lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, origValue, fromType);
04943     }
04944 
04945     const VectorType *toVector = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(toType);
04946     const VectorType *fromVector = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(fromType);
04947     if (toVector && fromVector) {
04948         // this should be caught during typechecking
04949         assert(toVector->GetElementCount() == fromVector->GetElementCount());
04950 
04951         llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
04952         if (!exprVal)
04953             return NULL;
04954 
04955         // Emit instructions to do type conversion of each of the elements
04956         // of the vector.
04957         // FIXME: since uniform vectors are represented as
04958         // llvm::VectorTypes, we should just be able to issue the
04959         // corresponding vector type convert, which should be more
04960         // efficient by avoiding serialization!
04961         llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
04962         for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
04963             llvm::Value *ei = ctx->ExtractInst(exprVal, i);
04964 
04965             llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, ei, toVector->GetElementType(),
04966                                                 fromVector->GetElementType(), pos);
04967             if (!conv) 
04968                 return NULL;
04969             cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
04970         }
04971         return cast;
04972     }
04973 
04974     llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
04975     if (!exprVal)
04976         return NULL;
04977 
04978     const EnumType *fromEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(fromType);
04979     const EnumType *toEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
04980     if (fromEnum)
04981         // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
04982         fromType = fromEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
04983             AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
04984     if (toEnum)
04985         // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
04986         toType = toEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
04987             AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
04988 
04989     const AtomicType *fromAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(fromType);
04990     // at this point, coming from an atomic type is all that's left...
04991     assert(fromAtomic != NULL);
04992 
04993     if (toVector) {
04994         // scalar -> short vector conversion
04995         llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toVector->GetElementType(),
04996                                             fromAtomic, pos);
04997         if (!conv) 
04998             return NULL;
04999 
05000         llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
05001         for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i)
05002             cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
05003         return cast;
05004     }
05005     else {
05006         const AtomicType *toAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
05007         // typechecking should ensure this is the case
05008         assert(toAtomic != NULL);
05009 
05010         return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toAtomic, fromAtomic, pos);
05011     }
05012 }
05013 
05014 
05015 const Type *
05016 TypeCastExpr::GetType() const { 
05017     return type; 
05018 }
05019 
05020 
05021 Expr *
05022 TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck() {
05023     if (expr != NULL) 
05024         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
05025     if (expr == NULL)
05026         return NULL;
05027 
05028     const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
05029     if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
05030         return NULL;
05031 
05032     const char *toTypeString = toType->GetString().c_str();
05033     const char *fromTypeString = fromType->GetString().c_str();
05034 
05035     // It's an error to attempt to convert from varying to uniform
05036     if (toType->IsUniformType() && !fromType->IsUniformType()) {
05037         Error(pos, "Can't assign 'varying' value to 'uniform' type \"%s\".",
05038               toTypeString);
05039         return NULL;
05040     }
05041 
05042     // And any kind of void type in a type cast doesn't make sense
05043     if (toType == AtomicType::Void || fromType == AtomicType::Void) {
05044         Error(pos, "Void type illegal in type cast from type \"%s\" to "
05045               "type \"%s\".", fromTypeString, toTypeString);
05046         return NULL;
05047     }
05048 
05049     // FIXME: do we need to worry more about references here?
05050 
05051     if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(fromType) != NULL) {
05052         // Starting from a vector type; the result type must be a vector
05053         // type as well
05054         if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(toType) == NULL) {
05055             Error(pos, "Can't convert vector type \"%s\" to non-vector type \"%s\".",
05056                   fromTypeString, toTypeString);
05057             return NULL;
05058         }
05059 
05060         // And the two vectors must have the same number of elements
05061         if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(toType)->GetElementCount() != 
05062             dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(fromType)->GetElementCount()) {
05063             Error(pos, "Can't convert vector type \"%s\" to differently-sized "
05064                   "vector type \"%s\".", fromTypeString, toTypeString);
05065             return NULL;
05066         }
05067 
05068         // And we're ok; since vectors can only hold AtomicTypes, we know
05069         // that type converting the elements will work.
05070         return this;
05071     }
05072     else if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromType) != NULL) {
05073         FATAL("Shouldn't ever get here");
05074         return this;
05075     }
05076     else {
05077         assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(fromType) != NULL ||
05078                dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(fromType) != NULL);
05079         // If we're going from an atomic or enum type, the only possible
05080         // result is another atomic or enum type
05081         if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType) == NULL &&
05082             dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType) == NULL) {
05083             Error(pos, "Can't convert from type \"%s\" to \"%s\".",
05084                   fromTypeString, toTypeString);
05085             return NULL;
05086         }
05087 
05088         return this;
05089     }
05090 }
05091 
05092 
05093 Expr *
05094 TypeCastExpr::Optimize() {
05095     if (expr != NULL) 
05096         expr = expr->Optimize();
05097     if (expr == NULL)
05098         return NULL;
05099 
05100     ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
05101     if (!constExpr)
05102         // We can't do anything if this isn't a const expr
05103         return this;
05104 
05105     const Type *toType = GetType();
05106     const AtomicType *toAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
05107     const EnumType *toEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
05108     // If we're not casting to an atomic or enum type, we can't do anything
05109     // here, since ConstExprs can only represent those two types.  (So
05110     // e.g. we're casting from an int to an int<4>.)
05111     if (toAtomic == NULL && toEnum == NULL)
05112         return this;
05113 
05114     bool forceVarying = toType->IsVaryingType();
05115 
05116     // All of the type conversion smarts we need is already in the
05117     // ConstExpr::AsBool(), etc., methods, so we just need to call the
05118     // appropriate one for the type that this cast is converting to.
05119     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = toAtomic ? toAtomic->basicType :
05120         AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
05121     switch (basicType) {
05122     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
05123         bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05124         constExpr->AsBool(bv, forceVarying);
05125         return new ConstExpr(toType, bv, pos);
05126     }
05127     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
05128         int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05129         constExpr->AsInt8(iv, forceVarying);
05130         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05131     }
05132     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
05133         uint8_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05134         constExpr->AsUInt8(uv, forceVarying);
05135         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05136     }
05137     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
05138         int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05139         constExpr->AsInt16(iv, forceVarying);
05140         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05141     }
05142     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
05143         uint16_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05144         constExpr->AsUInt16(uv, forceVarying);
05145         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05146     }
05147     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
05148         int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05149         constExpr->AsInt32(iv, forceVarying);
05150         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05151     }
05152     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
05153         uint32_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05154         constExpr->AsUInt32(uv, forceVarying);
05155         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05156     }
05157     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
05158         float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05159         constExpr->AsFloat(fv, forceVarying);
05160         return new ConstExpr(toType, fv, pos);
05161     }
05162     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
05163         int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05164         constExpr->AsInt64(iv, forceVarying);
05165         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05166     }
05167     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
05168         uint64_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05169         constExpr->AsUInt64(uv, forceVarying);
05170         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05171     }
05172     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
05173         double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05174         constExpr->AsDouble(dv, forceVarying);
05175         return new ConstExpr(toType, dv, pos);
05176     }
05177     default:
05178         FATAL("unimplemented");
05179     }
05180     return this;
05181 }
05182 
05183 
05184 int
05185 TypeCastExpr::EstimateCost() const {
05186     // FIXME: return COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX when appropriate
05187     return COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE;
05188 }
05189 
05190 
05191 void
05192 TypeCastExpr::Print() const {
05193     printf("[%s] type cast (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
05194     expr->Print();
05195     printf(")");
05196     pos.Print();
05197 }

05204     : Expr(p) {
05205     expr = e;

05209 llvm::Value *
05210 ReferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05211     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05212     return expr ? expr->GetLValue(ctx) : NULL;
05213 }
05214 
05215 
05216 Symbol *
05217 ReferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
05218     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
05219 }
05220 
05221 
05222 const Type *
05223 ReferenceExpr::GetType() const {
05224     if (!expr) 
05225         return NULL;
05226 
05227     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
05228     if (!type) 
05229         return NULL;
05230 
05231     return new ReferenceType(type, false);
05232 }
05233 
05234 
05235 Expr *
05236 ReferenceExpr::Optimize() {
05237     if (expr) 
05238         expr = expr->Optimize();
05239     if (expr == NULL)
05240         return NULL;
05241 
05242     return this;
05243 }

05247 ReferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
05248     if (expr != NULL) 
05249         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
05250     if (expr == NULL)
05251         return NULL;
05252     return this;
05253 }

05257 ReferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const {
05258     return 0;
05259 }

05262 void
05263 ReferenceExpr::Print() const {
05264     if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
05265         return;
05266 
05267     printf("[%s] &(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
05268     expr->Print();
05269     printf(")");
05270     pos.Print();

05274 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
05275 // DereferenceExpr
05276 
05277 DereferenceExpr::DereferenceExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
05278     : Expr(p) {
05279     expr = e;
05280 }
05281 
05282 
05283 llvm::Value *
05284 DereferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05285     if (expr == NULL) 
05286         return NULL;
05287     llvm::Value *ptr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05288     if (ptr == NULL)
05289         return NULL;
05290     const Type *type = GetType();
05291     if (type == NULL)
05292         return NULL;
05293 
05294     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05295     return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, NULL, type, "reference_load");
05296 }
05297 
05298 
05299 llvm::Value *
05300 DereferenceExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05301     if (expr == NULL) 
05302         return NULL;
05303     return expr->GetValue(ctx);
05304 }
05305 
05306 
05307 Symbol *
05308 DereferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
05309     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
05310 }
05311 
05312 
05313 const Type *
05314 DereferenceExpr::GetType() const {
05315     return (expr && expr->GetType()) ? expr->GetType()->GetReferenceTarget() : 
05316         NULL;
05317 }
05318 
05319 
05320 Expr *
05321 DereferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
05322     if (expr != NULL)
05323         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
05324     if (expr == NULL)
05325         return NULL;
05326     return this;
05327 }
05328 
05329 
05330 Expr *
05331 DereferenceExpr::Optimize() {
05332     if (expr != NULL) 
05333         expr = expr->Optimize();
05334     if (expr == NULL)
05335         return NULL;
05336     return this;
05337 }
05338 
05339 
05340 int
05341 DereferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const {
05342     return COST_DEREF;
05343 }

05345 
05346 void
05347 DereferenceExpr::Print() const {
05348     if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
05349         return;
05350 
05351     printf("[%s] *(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
05352     expr->Print();
05353     printf(")");
05354     pos.Print();
05355 }

05358 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
05359 // SymbolExpr
05360 
05361 SymbolExpr::SymbolExpr(Symbol *s, SourcePos p) 
05362   : Expr(p) {
05363     symbol = s;
05364 }
05365 
05366 
05367 llvm::Value *
05368 SymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05369     // storagePtr may be NULL due to an earlier compilation error
05370     if (!symbol || !symbol->storagePtr)
05371         return NULL;
05372     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05373     return ctx->LoadInst(symbol->storagePtr, NULL, NULL, symbol->name.c_str());
05374 }
05375 
05376 
05377 llvm::Value *
05378 SymbolExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05379     if (symbol == NULL)
05380         return NULL;
05381     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05382     return symbol->storagePtr;
05383 }
05384 
05385 
05386 Symbol *
05387 SymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
05388     return symbol;
05389 }
05390 
05391 
05392 const Type *
05393 SymbolExpr::GetType() const { 
05394     return symbol ? symbol->type : NULL;
05395 }
05396 
05397 
05398 Expr *
05399 SymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
05400     return this;
05401 }
05402 
05403 
05404 Expr *
05405 SymbolExpr::Optimize() {
05406     if (symbol == NULL)
05407         return NULL;
05408     else if (symbol->constValue != NULL) {
05409         assert(GetType()->IsConstType());
05410         return symbol->constValue;
05411     }
05412     else
05413         return this;
05414 }
05415 
05416 
05417 int
05418 SymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
05419     // Be optimistic and assume it's in a register or can be used as a
05420     // memory operand..
05421     return 0;
05422 }
05423 
05424 
05425 void
05426 SymbolExpr::Print() const {
05427     if (symbol == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
05428         return;
05429 
05430     printf("[%s] sym: (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(), 
05431            symbol->name.c_str());
05432     pos.Print();
05433 }

05436 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
05437 // FunctionSymbolExpr
05438 
05439 FunctionSymbolExpr::FunctionSymbolExpr(const char *n,
05440                                        std::vector<Symbol *> *candidates,
05441                                        SourcePos p) 
05442   : Expr(p) {
05443     name = n;
05444     matchingFunc = NULL;
05445     candidateFunctions = candidates;
05446 }
05447 
05448 
05449 const Type *
05450 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetType() const {
05451     return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->type : NULL;
05452 }
05453 
05454 
05455 llvm::Value *
05456 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05457     assert("!should not call FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue()");
05458     return NULL;
05459 }
05460 
05461 
05462 Symbol *
05463 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
05464     return matchingFunc;
05465 }
05466 
05467 
05468 Expr *
05469 FunctionSymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
05470     return this;
05471 }
05472 
05473 
05474 Expr *
05475 FunctionSymbolExpr::Optimize() {

05485 
05486 void
05487 FunctionSymbolExpr::Print() const {
05488     if (!matchingFunc || !GetType())
05489         return;
05490 
05491     printf("[%s] fun sym (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
05492            matchingFunc->name.c_str());
05493     pos.Print();
05494 }

05502     return AtomicType::Void;
05503 }

05507 SyncExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05508     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05509     ctx->SyncInst();
05510     return NULL;
05511 }
